<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Don't you want the other cure attempts to work?
Please. I'm sure it will help.
Okay, maybe it help.
If you wish. I doubt it will do anything.
Whatever. It probably do nothing.
No, thank you.
Not for me, no.
I'll not have your useless blessing!
You keep your useless blessing thing!
I want to ask about the other city districts.
Me ask about other city places.
Is your temple accesible? I may need clerical services.
Your temple open for selling? Me sometimes need cleric stuff.
How long has the temple been closed?
You been closed for long time?
Can I ask you about Helm's Hold?
Me maybe ask about Helm's Hold?
Blessings upon you. Is there aught I can do for you?
Speak what ye will, friend. I will answer.
What would you make of my time? Speak quickly, for I have much to do.
I have nothing to improve the state of your mind, if that is what you require. I can, however, answer simple questions.
I will answer, though I am a newcomer too. Granting blessings in this time of plague has not left much time for exploration.
The Wailing pulls at the soul, spiritually tearing a victim apart from within. The blessings I give are small comfort, but comfort nonetheless.
Most are foolish sorcery, and none have proven effective. We Helmites under Desther are certain that only our blessings will deliver Neverwinter.
There has also been much hoarding of gold. Muggings are rampant. I hope it does not harm the spirit of the people further.
Perhaps we could have prevented the events that befell the place. The loss of so many is a great tragedy.
People are reluctant at first, but the more the plague strikes at them, the more they abandon such things and seek what we offer.
It was thought the plague could be contained there, but even as we try to calm people, the Wailing follows soon after.
The blessings will accomplish this. Other actions can certainly follow, but care must be taken not to do more harm than good.
We Helmites will do what is necessary. Our blessings will deliver the city. You will see.
I have heard that the undead that were roaming the area are calmed now. Not that people should endanger themselves facing such things...
They hoarded resources away from the poorer of Neverwinter's citizens. Someone has, however, put a stop to it.
I hear, however, that the area is quite calm now. I hope no one was foolishly put at risk by rash action.
As you will. Would you like a blessing as you go?
Hmm... I have only just acquainted myself with the city, but I will assist you if I can.
Don't waste your time following conjecture. You should be more concerned about your spiritual well-being.
There are several districts dividing the city. The division has apparently slowed the plague, but it divides people as well.
I believe the different regions are the Beggar's Nest, the Docks, the Blacklake district, the Peninsula, and the City Core.
No, not really. Of course, I busy myself with concern for the plagued, and do not worry about petty scandal.
I know little of these things. I need only my blessings. Still, I believe there are a few establishments that have what you want.
I have seen a number of characters enter the Moonstone Mask in the central west. I gather they cater to the stealthy.
Are you a servant of nature? There is a Druid Tree in the City Core upper square east, though I am unfamiliar with them.
Our Helmite Temple is closed while we continue our blessings. The Temple of Tyr in the City Core upper square west will assist you.
If you know of arcane magic, the Cloak Tower may assist you. It is just outside Castle Never.
If you are a master of weapons, the Shining Knight Arms and Armor in the southeast City Core seem to be well-stocked.
Not that I truly know anything of the place. I merely mention it as a courtesy. Better you avoid it, I'm sure.
I have also heard of a mercenary enclave that hires out henchmen. It is the Trade of Blades in the southwest, but I would avoid it.
Ah, the spiritual and governmental center. We Helmites have established a small temple here, with Desther as our guide.
We are not far from Castle Never, and serve as advisors in all the major institutions. Not all heed our words, but they will in time.
The Beggar's Nest? Our blessings are a comfort, but have been unable to lessen the impact of the Wailing in the district.
The Docks are a haven for lawlessness, even in this otherwise dark time. Thankfully my brethren have been mostly left to do their good work.
Blacklake is the home of the nobility, a group that I am sorry to say has not borne the weight of these times in a distinguished manner.
It is possible they are even hoarding resources meant for the poorer Districts. Hopefully no one inflames the situation.
The Peninsula is where the prison is located. Try as we might, we Helmites have not been allowed much access within.
There are many shops around the outer District edge as well, though I haven't seen what they hold. I haven't had the time.
Hopefully my brethren in the area have continued their blessings and the spirit of that has found a way within to some degree.
I'm not sure I approve, as the potential for loss of life was high, but I suppose these things must be done.
Especially now, as I have heard that contact with the great fortress has been sporadic. The proper authorities will need time to sort things out.
I would avoid the Docks, friend. Let we Helmites administer our blessings and calm the situation in our gentle way.
Now I fear there is an unforseen threat of undead in the District. Leave it to the Helmites, my friend. Do not endanger yourself there.
I hope no further rash action is taken. The gentle blessings of we Helmites should be allowed to take precedence. Spirits must be healed.
Certainly, but in the proper perspective. The plague will fall not to brute force, but to the growth of hope within the people.
Everyone seeks the end of the plague. We under Desther merely believe that our methods will bring the swiftest resolution.
In the end, I think people will look back and realize the importance of the role we played, even if they cannot see it now.
As you will. Good luck to you.
The blessings of we Helmites upon you. May it deliver you beyond the plague.
Which in particular interests you?
Ah, normally we of the faithful would not object to showing you around, but I fear that our temple is currently closed to the public.
You see... ah... Although we treat the sick without hesitation, we can't risk contaminating our blessing pools. We must keep the temple secure.
Well, I accompanied Desther from Helm's Hold shortly after the plague began. He wisely decided to close it soon after we arrived.
It is a shame, but necessary. Most of the Helmites that were here previously fell to the plague. All that remain now are we that arrived with Desther.
Oh, I am not an authority on the place. I mean, I am a Helmite, of course, but my time in the Hold was limited.
Besides, it is days away and hardly worth considering. There is so much here that deserves our attention. Do you require anything else?
Could I ask you some questions?
Me want ask questions.
Goodbye.
What can you tell me about the plague?
Have you heard anything about strange animals in the area?
Can you tell me what's going on in this area?
What you know 'bout plague? Anything?
You hear 'bout weird animals around here?
What go on around here?
Do you know anything else about it?
You knows something else maybe?
Maybe you've heard of something of interest?
I'd be interested in work, if you know of anything.
Are there any places of interest in the core I should visit?
Maybe you hears something interesting?
Me want work.
You know good places to go here?
So you haven't heard about any animals in this area?
So you not hear about animals 'round here?
I'm investigating the plague. Perhaps you could tell me more about it.
Me look into plague. Maybe you know more?
I want to ask you something else.
Me have other question.
Can I ask you some directions?
Neverwinter big place. Me need directions.
Aren't you in danger of becoming infected yourself?
Where are all these dead people coming from?
This can't be a pleasant task for you.
You not in danger of catching plague here?
Where the dead come from?
This not a nice job, huh?
You believe you'll see your family again when you die?
You're a fool to take such a risk.
I hope you're right. That you'll see your family.
May the gods watch over you, brother. May they watch over us all.
You thinks you see family again when you dies?
You'se a fool to think that.
Me hope you'se right, that you sees family again.
May gods watch over you, brother. May gods watch us all.
Uh-huh. Let me ask you something else.
Uhhh... me ask you other question now.
Let me ask you something else, then.
Me have other question.
I urge you to keep away from these bodies, my <lord/lady>. There is a risk of contagion, I understand.
May Helm watch over you, my <lord/lady>.
May Ilmater have mercy on us all.
Begone and leave me to my grim task.
Questions, is it? Helm grant me patience.
I suppose there's no harm in chatting a bit. Do mind the bodies, my <lord/lady>. Try not to breath the fumes directly... ugh... it's disgusting...
I'll answer what I can. Just keep back from the pile, <sir/madam>. Try not to breath the fumes directly... ugh... it's disgusting...
Speak quickly, then. I'm not in the mood to be interrogated. Try not to breath the fumes of the burning pile directly... ugh... it's disgusting...
Besides the obvious? The Wailing Death can't be cured by the gods, it seems. None of them clerics' blessings do a thing.
Animals? That sounds familiar. I heard something about some animals arriving from Waterdeep, but nothing more beyond that.
The Wailing Death is going on, fool. Ahhh, don't mind me, <sir/madam>. The core is no place for any sane man to be these days.
Do you have a speech impediment? Oh, nevermind.
There's no work that I know of, <sir/madam>. Maybe you could check at the Trade of Blades or Castle Never... but I doubt anyone is hiring.
Interesting? I can't think of a single thing that holds any interest for me anymore. Nothing except maybe trying to save the souls that are left alive here.
Well I suppose that's about as direct as one can get.
Is there something else you wanted to know?
I really can't think of anything else to add to that, sorry.
Is there something else you need, then?
*Sigh* Look at what I do, <sir/madam>. Very few people care to talk to me at length, if at all. Maybe you'd have more luck asking these things at a local tavern.
Is there something else you wanted, then?
Stand back, <sir/madam>. All of these poor souls are victims of the plague.
Keep back, fool, or risk catching the Wailing Death yourself.
Everyone knows something about the plague. Half of it isn't true and the other half is rumor. I'm not sure I can add much to it all.
I am not from this district. Nor would I be inclined to point your way, <sir/madam>, even if I were. Ask someone else for aid.
What do you want to know?
I suppose it wouldn't occur to you to buy a map, now, would it?
I am. If I fall, I will be far from the first amongst the city guard to do so. All I can ask is that Helm watch over me and protect me from this evil.
These? These are all plague victims, of course. Many of the fools tried to gain access to the City Core and died at the quarantine gates.
Some of them are locals, however. The Wailing Death has come to the core, despite our efforts. I expect things will only get worse before they get better.
It seems a shame to burn these poor souls, to not even give them a decent burial. We have no choice, however. Ilmater help us, no choice at all.
Far from it. The Wailing Death has already taken my wife and my only son from me, however. 'Tis not as if it can get any worse, for me.
If I catch the plague here, it won't be so bad. At least I'd see my family again. There are other guards that still have folks to live for.
I can only hope so. The Helmites say so... but, then, Helm isn't answering them anymore, is he? Maybe there is nothing better.
Maybe so, but it's my risk to take. Maybe I just don't care what happens to me anymore, if that's all right with you.
I hope so, too. The Helmites say that's the way of it, but Helm isn't answering their calls. Maybe the gods have abandoned us finally.
Bless you for your kindness. I have the feeling that no one's watching over us, anymore, though.
*Sigh* I'm sorry. Was there something else you wanted to know?
Makes you think maybe the gods have abandoned us, doesn't it? Makes you think worse is coming. Makes you think winter is coming, even.
No doubt it's something for the others in the city guard to worry about. In this post, they don't tell me much.
No. Nothing that would interest you, I'm sure. Perhaps you should ask at the Moonstone Mask.
The Mask is a bordello, to be sure, but it's where all the folk are crowding these days. Poor souls looking for a bit of joy in all this bleakness.
Me, I haven't the stomach for it. I'll die soon enough, to be sure.
What would you wish to know?
Stand back. These bodies carry the plague.
Could I ask you some questions?
Me want ask questions.
Goodbye.
Do you know anything about what causes it?
Have you heard anything about strange animals in the area?
Is there anything going on in this area of the city?
You know how you gets it?
You hear 'bout weird animals around here?
What go on 'round here?
Anything else you can tell me?
You knows something else maybe?
Maybe you've heard of something of interest?
I'd be interested in work, if you know of anything.
Maybe you hears something interesting?
Me want work.
Could you tell me anything about the plague?
You know 'bout plague, maybe?
I want to ask you something else.
Me have other question.
I need some directions.
Neverwinter big place. Me need directions.
Why are you out here on the street? You're sick, you should be inside somewhere.
How has the plague affected your trade?
Why you out here on street? You sick, should be inside.
Plague make your trade very bad, yeah?
Let me ask you something else, then.
Me have other question.
A gold or two? For you? You must be joking.
Golds? For you? You is joking, ha ha!
Err... about those sores...
You haves sores. You gots plague, no?
Why wouldn't you go to the Moonstone Mask?
Why not Moonstone Mask?
But you certainly don't need the coin if, ah...
You not need coin if you going to, umm...
You have the plague?! Get away from me!!
You has plague?! Get away!!
Waste coin on you? I think not.
I have nothing to give.
Here... take a gold piece.
Take this: 100 gp. Go and find someplace warm tonight, and rest.
Waste coin? Me thinks not.
Me has nothing to give.
Here... you take gold piece.
Take this: 100 gp. You go and finds someplace warm, and rest.
<StartAction>[Ignore her]</Start>
I could offer you mercy. A quick and painless death.
Me can give mercy. Quick death, no pain.
Aye, now... how about a lad like yourself takes a lass like me for an evening o' pleasure? Only a gold or two, no more.
I... a workin' girl does not normally beg t' make her keep, my <lord/lady>... but these ain't no normal times. Could you spare some kindness, mayhap?
Aye, begone, churl.
Questions, is it? Helm grant me patience.
Oh, certainly, my <lord/lady>. That's how I get my gold, after all. Answering questions.
Oh, fine, fine. It's not like the gold is leaping into my lap today, after all.
Followed by a dagger to my belly, no doubt. Oh, go ahead, already.
Naw. We working girls deal with sickness plenty enough, but this ain't got nothing to do with that. The sickness is in the air, an' there ain't no one who's immune.
Strange animals? You mean beasts? No, I've heard nothin' about any beasts in these parts.
There's always things going on in the core. Most of it is out o' reach of my ears, however, except maybe the urgent whisperings of dyin' men.
Do you have a speech impediment? Oh, nevermind.
Nobody's spending coin, so nobody's hiring. Except maybe at the Moonstone... but even there probably not.
Well I suppose that's about as direct as one can get.
Oh, I suppose there's work to be had. There's all kinds of things people need doin', especially with a city in chaos. Nothing that reaches my ears, however.
Nope. Wait around some, you'll learn all you wants to an' more, I'm sure.
Is there something else you need, then?
Is there something else you wanted, then?
What do you need, girl? I have to work, yet, for a gold or so... lest I sleep in the street again an' catch the plague myself.
I can tells you plenty about the plague. From personal experience, in fact. Anything specific you wanted to know, aye?
Go on, now, I don't have time to give directions when you could just find things yourself. Ask a guard, it'll keep them busy and away from me.
What do you want to know?
I suppose it wouldn't occur to you to buy a map, now, would it?
Inside where? When you has the plague, nobody wants to take you in. You ain't got no family, even. And I ain't settin' foot in the Moonstone Mask, no way.
Hah! You'd think it would be bad, that us girls would find nary a customer in all of Neverwinter who'd lie with us for a night, aye? Not at all, says I.
The souls in this city, they all thinks they're going to die. Convinced of it, they are. So they pile together in the Moonstone Mask, lookin' for a last bit of joy.
An' they look even for me. There's folks with the Wailing Death... they ain't deserved it none. They want a bit o' joy, just the same... and I won't be turning them away none.
The girls at the Moonstone, they don't seem t' get the plague none. Could be the matron mother just hides it real well. More like, 'n fact.
If you're tellin' me that there's beasts roaming about the core... well, I don't want to hear none of it. There's enough death comin' for you in the nights as it is.
Depends. You could go to Castle Never, t'is interesting enough. Send them me love, if you would.
Walk around, if ye wish. I'm sure you'll find all sorts to interest you, <lad/lass>.
What would you wish to know?
Oh, aye, aye. I've got the plague or something just as good, an' you don't. You may wag your finger at me, <lad/lass>, but I ain't dead yet.
So is there something you actually wanted, then, or are ye just going to stare?
Hmph. I don't like the matron mother none, that Ophala Cheldarstorn. Something not right with her, I says.
That an' the Moonstone has too many rules. No, no, the only place for me is out on th' streets. That way, when I die, I ain't far from the pile over yonder.
If I'm going to die, is that it? Yes, I'm going to die. But I got me babes, an' they ain't sick. They going to be orphans, soon.
That'll be bad enough, for them. I'm going to give 'em what I can, before the Wailing Death takes me. Nothin' else I can do.
Aye. I'll be going away soon enough, no need to rush. Move along with ye, rabbit.
Then begone, cruel <lord/lady>. May the plague take ye, too.
I... no. No, my <lord/lady>. I thank you, but 'tis not my time just yet.
Then leave me be and go on yer ways.
Thank you, my <lord/lady>, you are most gracious and kind. My babes will eat tonight, thanks to you.
I... you are too kind, my <lord/lady>! Bless you, bless your heart! My babes... my babes will live, once I'm gone. Bless you!!
Back again, my <lord/lady>? You should really not be hangin' about me so much... I *am* ill with the Wailing Death, my <lord/lady>.
Oh, certainly, my <lord/lady>.
*Sigh* Nothing to live for. May as well spend my last gold on a few nights of fun.
Hey, now, don't butt your way in line. We all get our turn with the girls.
Stay away from me! You never know who has the plague!
Just came down from one of the rooms, did you?
Err... you're a bit eager to get the festivities started, aren't you?
Poor soul lost everything, I see. Have a brother who ended up the same way.
You can't come in here wounded like that!
Ahhh! It's a plague victim, spouting blood everywhere!
Get away from me! Under all that blood you probably have the Wailing Death!
Do you work for Ophala? I hear she has some simpleton guards, she does.
Hmph. Funny how the lackwits never get the plague, but the good ones die off.
Don't come near me! You were probably stricken dumb by the plague!
You needn't brandish your weapon here, <mister/missus>.
Stop waving that about, will you, <mister/missus>? You're making me nervous.
Ophala will kick you out of here if you keep walking around with that unsheathed.
Get lost, holy <man/woman>! We don't need your kind here!
If you holy folk were any good, your gods would listen to you and heal us!
Hmph. Awfully strange place for a holy <man/woman> like yourself, no?
Miss Ophala doesn't appreciate spell-casting around here, so keep it to yourself.
Magic caused the plague. My cousin told me that for sure.
Why don't you just go back to wherever you came from, magic-user?
Oh! It's not often I encounter <race> kin in these parts. How do you do?
It's always a delight to see another <race> face around here.
Be wary of the humans in this town. If they don't think you started the plague, they'll claim <race> soup is the cure.
Hello, miss. Err... you're one of Ophala's girls, aren't you?
I gots four gold. Care to make a deal, miss? Five? Six?
They say Miss Ophala keeps her girls plague-free... and I must admit, you sure do look healthy.
You've come to a good place. Ophala keeps her girls free of the plague, I hear.
They brought in something from Waterdeep that was supposed to cure us, but it's been lost, I hear. Too bad.
Might as well have some fun before the Wailing Death takes us, you know what I mean?
The gods have abandoned us. The Helmites can't even cure the plague with their blessings, you know that?
You just get lost, now! Don't need no plague spread to the fine girls, here.
You're here to have some fun, too, 'fore the Wailing Death takes you, hey?
I didn't know they let barbarians into the Moonstone Mask.
You mean they actually allow uncultured barbarians to walk around here?
Hmph. You barbarians probably brought this plague with you from the mountains.
Wonderful. Another of you <race> people in the city. Funny how you folk don't seem to catch the plague none...
Keep away from me! You <race> kind have the plague, everyone knows that!
Hmmm. Someone told me that <race> blood cured the plague. You heard o' that?
You can have a turn when I'm done here.
I'm busy with the girls, here, can't you see that?
Get away from me! You have the look of the plague about you!
Get lost, ya naked imp!
Get back in yer room and put some clothes on, for Ilmater's sake!
One of the girls kick you out, did she?
You can't wave about a weapon up here, are you mad?!
Stop waving that about and go away!
You're going to frighten everyone, waving that about!
Excuse me, but I'm trying to conduct some business.
You'll have to talk to Miss Ophala, <sir/madam>.
Go throw yourself on a midden heap, already.
I'm busy conducting some business, so I'll thank you not to interrupt.
Go away! I'm busy here, can't you see that?
Don't interrupt me!!
Get lost. We don't need no <race> kind up here.
Don't interrupt me, <race> one.
I'm conducting some business, <race> jerk, can't you see that?
Please don't interrupt, <sir/madam>. We're trying to conduct some business.
Hello, I'm rather busy right now. Sorry.
I don't have time for your like. You'll wait your turn.
(giggle!) A little eager to begin, are we?
You can't run around like *that*! Miss Ophala will have a fit!
Awww, poor baby lost <his/her> clothes in a game of chance, did <he/she>?
You can't wave your weapons about like that. Stop it.
Put your weapons away right now, or I'll call Miss Ophala!
(giggle!) Is that a weapon you're waving about or are you just happy to see me?
My my. Yet *another* holy <man/woman>. Must be my lucky day.
You know, you holy folk can't just butt into line like this.
Why, *hello* there, <brother/sister>...
Sorry, we don't service magic-users here.
Go away, wizard, or I'll call Miss Ophala.
We don't want any of your spells here. You'd best leave.
I don't recognize you. You aren't one of my sisters here, are you?
Hey! Miss Ophala doesn't let no private girls in here, you know!
What are you doing up here, girl? Best go back downstairs.
My, my. Hello there, handsome.
Ignore this peasant man, sir. I'll give you a discount...
You haven't found another girl already, have you? I'm your lass...
You're new to the Mask, aren't you? Well, I'm sure you'll like it...
*Sigh* Business has been a little *too* busy since the plague hit, you know what I mean... ?
You'll have to wait your turn.
I don't know how Ophala keeps us free of the sickness, but she does.
Oh, by the gods! Must all the dregs of society come in here?
Go away, you plague-ridden filth!
Hmmm. I charge <race> kind extra, you know.
Please stay away. I was told <race> kind carry the plague!
Miss Ophala let another of your <race> kind come up here?
Ye seems amiable enough... but we ain't hiring new hands until this whole business is over with.
We ain't hiring new hands. Be off with ye.
Get lost. I've no wish to talk to the likes of ye.
Ha ha! Just come out of th' Moonstone Mask, did ya? Lose something?
Lost yer shirt at the gambling table, I see. Ha ha!
Yer not some naked plague victim, are ya? Get away, already!
What are you doing, running in here getting blood all over the place?!
You're bloody injured! Or are you some plague victim? Out! Get out!!
Must have been some fight, by the look of ye.
I had a cousin slow like ye. He were a mercenary, too... but he drowned in a puddle.
I've no time for simpletons. We're not hiring, anyway.
What? Has the bloody plague stricken ye dumb?
Don't walk around with yer weapon out unless ye means to use it.
You keep wavin' that about, and you'll be in for a world of hurt, <lad/lass>.
Sheathe it, <lad/lass>, or ye'll just cause trouble.
Ye holy folk should stay in the church for all the bloody good ye're doing.
And why haven't yer gods done anything about this plague, eh?
Haven't seen a holy <man/woman> in these parts since the Helmites run off.
If yer smart, magic-user, ye'll keep yer spells well-hidden.
Don't suppose you wizardly folk can do anything about this plague? Hmph, thought not.
Sorry, we ain't hiring wizards. Off with ye.
Yer a mighty fine-lookin' wench. Just wander over from the Moonstone Mask, did ya?
Let's find us a quiet corner and I'll make a woman out of ya, lass. Ha ha!
Yer pretty enough, but probably diseased like every other git in this city.
Best be careful the Wailing Death doesn't catch ya, <lad/lass>.
I'd invite ye to join us, <lad/lass>, but there's hardly room.
Now this is a sorry state. Can't leave the city, an' can't do anything while we're here. 'Cept wait for the Wailing Death to take us.
Don't stand so close. Ya never know who gots the Wailing Death, 'til it's too late.
We wouldn't hire yer like even if our pockets were full of gold... which they ain't.
Don't come near me! Don't know who might have the plague, an ye looks like a fine candidate.
You barbarians are all the same. Smell like ye just woke up in a bear's bowels.
We got no room for barbarians 'round here. Go back to yer mountains.
Ye looks like ye can handle your weapon, barbarian, but we ain't hiring.
We ain't never hired no <race> kind before, so get lost.
I got better things to do then be chatted up by some <race> fool.
You best be careful. There's some folks who think that your <race> kin caused the plague.
I needed to ask a few questions.
Can you maybe answer questions for me?
Goodbye.
Can you tell me anything about Lady Aribeth?
What can you tell me about Neverwinter?
Can you tell me anything about my duties?
You tells me about Lady Aribeth? Who she?
You tells me stuff about Neverwinter?
You maybe know what me supposed to do?
What she do? Why she in charge?
Who is she to claim authority over me?
What is her position? Why is she in charge?
Why she think she boss of me?
Me ask different questions.
Could you at least say if it's pointless charity work?
You maybe say if it be stupid charity work?
I want to ask something different.
Well met. I assume you are a new recruit of the Neverwinter militia? You look like you will be a fine addition.
Greetings to you. I assume you are new addition to the Neverwinter Militia? You'll prove adequate, I'm sure.
Hello. You are a new recruit for the Neverwinter Militia, correct? I suppose we must make do with whatever help we can get.
I will try, but only so this remedial instruction is addressed before bothering Lady Aribeth with it. You are meant to deal with her exclusively.
I'll answer what I can, but Lady Aribeth is better informed about these matters.
Lady Aribeth will inform you of anything you need to know. I am merely to direct you to speak with her.
Another time, and be sure to present any questions you have to Lady Aribeth. She is in the next room.
I'm sorry, I am merely supposed to direct you to Lady Aribeth. Anything else you will have to investigate on your own.
Aribeth will clarify what is required of you. I couldn't add anything to what she might say.
New recruits of the city militia should report to Lady Aribeth as soon as possible.
If you have already spoken with Lady Aribeth, I'm not sure I have much of value to add. You should address your concerns with her.
I would advise that you speak with Lady Aribeth as soon as possible. She will brief you on what is required of you.
I assume from your tone that you will want the opportunity for profit? I understand. Not everyone joins out of the goodness of their heart.
I am sure you will find what you require. I don't approve, but there are ways to capitalize on desperate times.
I would suggest, however, that you refrain from telling Aribeth. She is trying to help those in need, and will not appreciate your financial goals.
She is Lady Aribeth de Tylmarande, trusted member of the Neverwinter Nine, and favored servant of Lord Nasher Alagondar, ruler of Neverwinter.
She has complete authority over the efforts to fight the plague, and that means everyone involved answers directly to her.
Now, in all seriousness, you must speak with her. I am only to serve as a signpost to newcomers.
Could I ask you some questions?
Me want ask questions.
Goodbye.
Thank you <sir/madam>, but I ain't interested in any charity you might be giving. I just don't have the interest in easin' yer noble guilt today.
Yeah, just leave me here. I've nowhere else to go.
No, please, I don't want to think about this anymore than I have to.
What do you want? I'm no guard, I can't help you. All I can do is wait for the plague to get me, and I can't even do that from my own bed.
Please don't hurt me. Haven't I suffered enough? I have nothing left. Not even a place of my own to lay down and die.
The zombies are all gone? I don't know what to say. I am so happy to be able to go home... I mean, it's just the Beggar's Nest... but it's all I've got left.
I just want to go home to the Beggar's Nest. That's all.
I had almost given up hope. I can't believe it.
Hello Oleff. I am <FullName>. Will you answer some questions?
My name is <FirstName>. I have some questions for you.
I'm <FirstName>. Enough chatter. I have questions for you.
Me <FullName>. Maybe me ask some questions?
Me <FirstName>. Stop yappin' and answer questions, okay?
Farewell for now.
Bye bye then.

<StartAction>Describe the recovery of Jacob's blessed quill from the evil Gilles.</Start>
Greetings of the Even-Handed to you. Welcome to the House of Tyr. I am Reverend Judge Oleff Uskar, in service of the Maimed God.
Tyr guide to you justice.
This Tyrran home welcomes your well-mannered address. Ask what you will, and I shall respond as I am able.
I am bound by Tyr to serve as long as the cause is just, but mind your tone. Disrespect is not tolerated in this place.
I will try, though I cannot guarantee you will fully understand my replies.
Temple services are available from Aribeth. She has stepped in to assist us because... well, we have suffered our own losses to the plague.
We serve as judges, juries and, should the situation require it, executioners. Justice through benevolent force and armed vigilance.
There are many aspects to the worship of Tyr. He is the Blind Overlord, the Even-Handed. He is the guardian and governor of justice.
The tenets of the faith are for the ears of the faithful. I will not parade them out so you can mock them with your brutish manner.
The clergy are charged to reveal the truth, punish the guilty, right the wrong, and to always be true and just in their actions.
The law is unyielding, but true justice is also merciful when circumstances dictate. That can be hard to remember in times of crisis.
We administer to the plague sufferers. Previously we were working on artifact recovery, which may be even more important now.
You are a monk, are you not? I do not know your precise spiritual bent, but you may understand the importance of what I require.
It is really a matter that would only concern someone more spiritually minded, and I don't think you are the type. No offense meant.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No, while I appreciate your offer, this would best be left to someone more inclined to understand the needs of the church.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Perhaps I was too quick to judge. You seem sincere enough. You may be able to understand why this is so important.
You might understand the significance of it, being a cleric yourself. Am I wrong? I can usually spot devout inclinations.
Certainly you will understand the importance of it. You walk with the gait of a paladin; we need that kind of dedication.
In the weeks before the plague, we uncovered the tomb of Miaslaznia Fairblade. She traveled widely with Halueth Never, founder of Neverwinter!
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No, I think it shall be left someone more appropriate, someone with adequate... eh... faculties.
This was a great discovery, and gave clues to the whereabouts of the founder's resting place. That would have been a great discovery indeed.
Greetings to you again, <CUSTOM701>. It is good to see you return to this house of Tyr.
Greetings. Are you with <CUSTOM701>? I am curious as to how the search for Halueth Never's tomb is going.
We have not seen the like of these in many many years. It brings new light to the wisdom of Halueth Never and his companions.
Contrary to your ignorant opinion, there are very valid reasons to pursue these tombs, especially now that the plague has ravaged the city.
Yes, it did. It is very unfortunate, because pursuing these tombs becomes all the more important with the city in crisis, as it is.
People are scared, and the lack of progress on a cure has diminished their hopes. A find like this would buoy their spirits.
There is also a chance that powerful artifacts could be found alongside Halueth Never's remains, though I would not rest my hopes upon it.
He was the founder of Neverwinter. Actually, not much is known about him, really. He's become a bit of a legendary figure.
That is unfortunate, and I understand how you might be reluctant. Please take this note, however, just in case you change your mind.
He reportedly fortified a fledgling Neverwinter against the Illusk barbarians, deflecting their wrath to Luskan and setting the tone for our uneasy relations with that city.
It signifies that you act with my sanction. Take it to Briley in the Peninsula district and he will aid you. He guards the one tomb already found.
It is in the basement of a house in the east side of the Peninsula district. Return to me if you find anything and I will reward you.
I welcome your aid in this matter. You couldn't have arrived at a more fortuitous time. Here, take this letter with my seal.
I hope there has been some progress with the search for Halueth Never's tomb. It would raise the spirits of the city.
Eh, you do not appear to have the letter that I gave you. Perhaps I forgot. I can give you another copy if you have misplaced it.
Very well. Briley in the Peninsula district will not help you without it. He is in the tomb we discovered in the basement of a house in the east side of the Peninsula district.
Well, please rememeber that you are free to change your mind. You have the letter I gave, do you not?
Another time, perhaps. Do please return.
Eh, if I am not mistaken, you have the letter I gave <CUSTOM701>. Has the weight of the task been transferred to you?
I would not be surprised if help had been enlisted. It is a big task, and even I am not sure of the dangers.
I hope that your attitude changes for the better. There really isn't anyone else suitable for this task right now.
Remember, take the letter to Briley in the Peninsula district in the center of the eastern edge. He will tell you what is known.
His very armor! And the location of his tomb! Who would have thought it was just beneath the surface, amidst so many others?
The plague snaps at the heart of Neverwinter, but we have a history. We shall fight with the newly detailed fury of Halueth Never.
You do? Wonderful. Please, tell me what it is that you have found.
Do not taunt us. The followers of Tyr do not brook such mischief at the best of times.
An excellent find! Neverwinter will benefit from learning about its auspicious origins. Perhaps we can find historical precedent for the plague as well.
As I said, you are to be rewarded. Here, take this 200 gold. It's not much, but there is more to come.
You have retrieved more than what we could have hoped for. A grand triad of artifacts, more than worthy of Never's legacy.
You have done much, and have even found the final resting place of Halueth Never, but what we have so far suggests there is more.
Your efforts are appreciated. A light has been cast on Halueth Never and his life, but there is still more to find.
We will guard well these items and the tombs they were found in. Take this amulet, and go with the blessing of Tyr.
There are further artifacts of his travels. Return to me if you find them. I shall reward you fairly, plus more when they are all recovered.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Perhaps I could see fit to granting you another boon of Tyr, but I cannot make this allowance again.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I do not wish to downplay your role, but the proper reward was given. Appreciate that, and take pride in your service.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No, no I think you are... confused. No, the proper reward was given. Be happy with that, and take pride in your service.
Thank you for your assistance, <CUSTOM701>. You were invaluable.
With heroes like <CUSTOM701>, and others, we will beat this.
The temple of Tyr, and indeed all of Neverwinter, thanks you for your sevice.
This adamantine is as much as I can manage. The temple is severely strained in this time..
It is ignorant and downright criminal to make such demands! I will ignore them just this once! Get out!
I will not tolerate this behavior in a house of Tyr, the god of justice! Leave me! You are no longer welcome here!
It speaks of his desire to be known as just another Neverwintan. Despite his greatness, he never forgot his home.
Knowing the details of his life could be very beneficial to the city. The people need to know they have a history of defeating adversity.
What?! He looted our fallen even as they gasped their last? I cannot imagine a more despicable act! Such disregard!
This item is not really an artifact, but I consider it valuable nonetheless. You are truly a friend of Tyr, risking yourself as you have. Take 500 gold as reward. It is the least we can do.
That beast looted our fallen even as they breathed their last? Despicable! You have done a great service by bringing him to task!
You are a great friend of Tyr, and will be remembered as such. Here, an additional 500 gold. It is the least we can do.
Unfortunately, it is very near the most we can do as well. Still, I hope it is sufficient. Thank you, <FirstName>. Thank you.
What? Let me see that. Oh, yes, of course. Please, just keep your voice down, and I'll get you what you need.
Let's see... hmmm... yes, I do believe you are plague free. Here is the document you need. Ophala should have no objection to your... patronage.
What? But... look, Ophala has friends in very high places. The Moonstone Mask would operate without my help. I just provide a service.
Is that all? Just gold? Listen, you! If I pay, I will never acknowledge this complaint again! Is that understood!?
I knew this would bite me in the ass one day. Very well. Here. 500 gold. Never speak of it again! I know I won't!
And no accusations. I'll do this, but I've already dealt with someone's scorn and I'm in no mood for chatter about it.
I am thoroughly disgusted by the nature of people, and refuse to assist you. You may blame the actions of a small number for my mood.
I welcome the return of this item, but it is a shining spot in an otherwise bleak day. It does little to improve my true mood.
Here. Take some gold. It would seem that the treasure is all some people care about.
Could I ask you some questions?
Me want ask questions.
Goodbye.
Please, good <sir/madam>, can you help? We have lost family to the plague, and escaped convicts in the Peninsula district prevent us from even mourning in our own homes.
Goodbye, I guess. Please, if you have a chance, can you please look into the trouble in the Peninsula? We have no one else to turn to.
I... I don't know what someone like me could tell you. All I know is that none of us can go home. The guards do nothing... The Peninsula is unimportant with the plague taking a larger toll.
Glad that somebody was willing to take those thieves to the woodshed. I gotta thank you. Now if you'll excuse me, I'm gonna get back to work in there.
I hate this. Someone should lay down the law.
That's the way things get done! Yes indeed!
Could I ask you some questions?
Me want ask questions.
Goodbye.
Pardon my improper greeting, <sir/madam>, but I really can't muster the interest today. The plague picks us off one by one, and I can't even hide in my home.
Fare you well. I will be here. There's nowhere else for me to go. Definitely not home.
I can't talk to anyone. I don't want to. I just want to be able to go home. Ah, why am I telling you this? You can't take on the whole Peninsula district.
What do you want? I thank you for your sympathy, if that's what you've come to offer, but the guards have already given us plenty of good wishes. Unfortunately it doesn't help get our homes back.
What do you want? Please tell me you're not one of the thugs that forced us out. I've nothing left to steal. I can't even huddle in my own home anymore.
I can't believe someone took the time to help us. Thank you for all you have done. It may not be much, but the Peninsula is where our homes are.
(sob) What are we to do?
I never thought I'd be able to go home again.
I have a letter from Oleff. He sent me.
Me have Oleff letter. He sent me heres?
Goodbye.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Yous can tell me. It be okay.
What do you know of the plague?
What can you tell me about these tombs?
Have you heard of anything odd? Any rumors?
You know anything about the bad plague?
What you can tell me about tombs?
Maybe you hear about odd stuff or rumors?
You know about cure attempts maybe?
What do you know about attempts at a cure?
What is this place?
What this place?
Who is Oleff?
Who Oleff?
Farewell.
Bye bye.
What have you learned from this tomb?
What you learn from this tomb?

Where other tombs located?

You finds artifact stuffs in here?

Me gots other questions and stuff.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You can tell me. Come on.
We share the calling of cleric. You can tell me.
We's both kinda cleric. Yous can tell me.
What a good looker like yous got to hide, hmm?
A handsome man like you needs to keep secrets?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Did this contribute to their deaths from the plague?
I'm really sorry, but even nobility are prohibited from being here. I have to wait for word from Reverend Judge Oleff Uskar.
I-I'm sorry, but you really shouldn't be in here. I'm waiting for word from Reverend Judge Oleff Uskar.
P-please, Only those with the permission of Reverend Judge Oleff Uskar can be here. There's nothing for you to steal, anyway.
I had hoped he would send someone more... uh... thoughtfuly skilled. You seem a little... less than qualified for historical recovery.
Thank goodness you are here. The plague has not been kind to our number... but the work of Tyr must still be done.
The Wailing has taken many, including my brethren that were digging here. Pity... they didn't have time to... well, I shouldn't speak of that.
The tomb we are in belongs to Miaslaznia Fairblade. It has been her resting place for a good many years, though I don't know exactly how long.
I have been guarding this... hole for several days now. I hear nothing but the scuffling of feet above and the sceaming in my own head.
Another time. Remember to look at Jacob's journal in the chest. He may have included some valuable information before he... well.
Y-you really shouldn't be here. I'm g-guarding this place, and I can't speak to you unless Oleff sent you to find the tombs of Never.
I suppose we are in no condition to protest. The plague has not been kind to our number, and the work must still be done.
She was a trusted friend of Halueth Never, so hopefully this place will hold clues as to where the founder himself is buried.
This one is very close to the surface, suggesting it may have been moved at least once in Neverwinter history, but no records tell of it.
Please, do not touch that. I've been instructed to only allow access to someone sent by Oleff.
It is a holy place, but I cannot speak of it to you. Please, I guard this place for the church of Tyr. You should not be here.
Reverend Judge Oleff Uskar. He directs the actions of we who follow Tyr. I can't allow access to anyone except those he has sent.
T-thank you for leaving. This has been a difficult time for the Tyrran faith. I wish I was back in the Hall of Justice.
The plague killed every member of the team that was digging it out. What they knew, mostly died with them. There is a journal, though.
The scribe Jacob was supposed to detail what they found, but I have not read his account. It is in the chest. You may open it.
I don't know. Jacob's journal in the chest may say, but I was not instructed to read it, so you will have to examine it yourself.
I hope it proves useful. It would be a shame for him to have died without having shared his knowledge.
I don't think so. Of course, I only arrived after the team died of the plague. I hope no one had the gall to disturb their bodies.
The journal in the chest may have other information, but I was not instructed to read it.
I will answer what I can.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I do not wish to speak ill of them, but I suppose the transgression was not that severe. Theirs was a small sin.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I don't think that would be appropriate. It's not your affair, even if you were sent by Oleff and intend to help the church.
Perhaps you can understand. I guess it wouldn't hurt to tell you. Theirs was a small sin in the grand scheme of things.
You have the loveliest eyes... well, I suppose it wouldn't hurt too much if you are interested. Theirs was only a small sin.
You have a... a rough charm to you, but... well, I suppose it does no good to keep secrets. Theirs was a small sin...
They... well, they seemed to lose some of their belief in the power of Tyr. I suppose faith is tested in times like these.
They consorted somewhat with the Helmites and accepted blessings. There are many gods, I know, and Tyr favors Helm well enough, but it didn't seem appropriate.
Again, it's a small sin. They committed no evil and performed their duty to the last. It's just a shame they couldn't erase that blemish...
But... this does not really concern you. They have departed this mortal realm, and you have other duties to attend to.
I wouldn't dare to say. Tyr didn't abandon them. The power of Tyr hasn't protected anyone from the plague thus far, so great is the evil of it.
I haven't heard anything, and it frightens me greatly. The church has made no headway and the forces of Lord Nasher falter as well.
I know not what spawned this terrible Wailing disease, but it is the most insidious of evils. May the gods have mercy upon us.
I'm sorry, I wish I knew of mysterious strangers or odd groups. It would put my mind at ease, and give reason to all of this.
For now, I just sit and hope that I'm not struck down myself. I must trust in the wisdom of Tyr.
I have been in this hole for days now. What do you expect me to hear? What brilliant secrets do you think inhabit the dark?
Farewell. Just remember to pay attention to Jacob's journal. It was in the chest here. I'm not sure who has it now.
His blessed quill will have been put to good use detailing what they found... strange... the quill is not here...
No one passes! Not past me!
Bound by Never! Never shall you pass!
Tombs of the Founder not to be found!
Guarded well for Never and ever!
What's downstairs? Is there something in your house?
What you mean? There something in your house?
You shouldn't be outside. It's dangerous.
You should be inside somewhere. Dangerous out here.
Goodbye.
Bye byes.
Is there something in your house?
There something in your house?
Hi there. You nice? You look nice. Momma says lots people aren't nice. Maybe even downstairs.
Who you? Ha? You come for my house? Don't think so. I'll kick your tail! Like I keep the bad guys downstairs!
You ugly. Basement ugly.
Heh. You funny.
You maybe kinda slow? You talk like Jegs, and momma says he's not all there. Don't know where he's going, though.
Yeah, there's something behind the bookcase, but momma says not to talk about... uh... I can't say anymore.
Okay, goodbye and stuff.
I 'spose, but Momma doesn't mind. She says people get sick at home at work and at church, so what's wrong with me in the street?
'Sides, she was mad because I went behind the bookcase again. Says it's not good to be there.
I guess there was, but some people chased stuff away. Nothing there now, I guess.
I don't want momma to know I know the secret word. You maybe go talk to her about it, okay?
I want to ask you some questions.
Me want some questions from yous
Goodbye.
What do you know of the plague?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> If there is something odd here, you should tell me.
You know anything about the bad plague?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> If something odd here, you tell me, okay?
What do you know about attempts at a cure?
You know about cure attempts maybe?
I want to ask something else.
Me ask something else.
Come now, fair lass, are you keeping secrets from me?
You pretty. You tell me if you hide stuff, nice lady.
Something's wrong here. What is it?! Tell me or die!
Something not right? You tell me! Tell me or die!
Are you telling me everything?!
That all you have to say? Well?!
What kind of sounds?
What sounds? What there?
I'm going to go look, all right?
Me go look and you not stop me!
Me gots to check it out.
I'm going to go look. Stay out of my way.
Do you know of anything odd? Any rumors?
You hear anything odd ever? Maybe rumor stuff?
You seem agitated. Are you all right?
You okay? You get all shakey.
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> You seem agitated. Is there something hidden here?
Go over this secret again for me.
You say about secret again for me, okay?
Tell me about what is going on here! Say or die!
You say what is happening here! Do it or die!
Beggin' your pardon, but why are you in my home? Not that nobility or the like can't go wherever they want. Uh...
Greetings. Why are you in my home? Not that you shouldn't be here, or anything. I don't really have a reason for you not to be here.
What's a creature like you doing in my home! Get out! I'll... I'll... Just get out! I won't even waste breath talking to you!
You mean answers? You a few biscuits short? Sorry, I don't mean anything, and I don't mean to object. There's nothing here for you, though...
I suppose... Is there a reason you are here? Again, I don't really mean to object, but if there's nothing here for you...
It kills people no matter where they go or what they do. Maybe the nobles can do something, but I'm just a servant.
Well, I was serving Lord Fontelbottom at his weekly Gelder's Club meeting, run by old Jim Gelder, you know, and he said something.
He said "cure creatures were lost to an attack." Sounds like gibberish to me. He hasn't been the same since... well... he's never been "all there."
Oh. All right then. Uh... please close the door behind you... ?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> You'll maybe do something about it? I won't have to worry about it no more? I guess I can talk.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Oh no, I'm staying right out of it. I don't know what's going on, and I don't want to.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> What do you know? Maybe you just don't have the sense to be afraid. Well fine, maybe you'll fix it by accident.
You've got some gall, flirting after inviting yourself into my house. Quite the charmer. I suppose I can tell you, if it'll get rid of you.
Ugh, no thank you. That might work on an ale-soaked wench in the City Core, but not with me. Not with your face, anyway.
Are you dim enough to think you can sweet-talk me after invading my home? That's... unique, I'll give it that. Fine, I'll tell you.
Why would you want to hurt me? I'll tell, of course... but why threaten?! It's just a word... just a strange little word. You say it and the bookcase opens. "Halueth" is the word.

I don't even know what it means. It's just... we used to hide things in the passage. We don't go too far, though. It's eerie... and smells... wrong. We used to hide things from the guards down there, but not anymore.
It's an old place... we dug out the basement and found it... now I wish we never had. There's something... behind the door.
I don't know, I don't know! Please! Just get out! Just get out!
Leave me alone! Please! Just leave my home!
Don't know why you're in my home now. Whatever was in my basement is done and gone. Maybe things will get back to normal now.

See, we found a note in an old book, and when we said a certain word, the bookcase moved. We were going to dig out behind it to make a secret place that guards wouldn't look, but we found... well, there was a tunnel.
There's... something not right down there. There's a door we could never open and... *sounds* that come from behind it. Look at the bookcase and say the word "Halueth." You'll see for yourself.
I don't know, and I won't try to find out! Maybe you want to, but I'm not going to go looking for ways to be stupid.
Would you go poking around in the dark? Maybe, but maybe you could handle it if you found something. Me, I'd just get killed.
That's your decision, I guess. The entrance is hidden behind the bookcase. Please, just try not to stir anything up. I have to live here.
All right, all right, the entrance is hidden behind the bookcase. Please, please don't stir up trouble. I have to live here.
And there's no reason you shouldn't go where you want. Really. I didn't mean to cause a fuss. My name is Telma... if you want to know.
No! I mean, of course not. Why would I know of anything odd? I mean, there's the plague, of course. What else needs to be happening besides that?
Oh, I'm fine, of course. Nothing wrong with me. Nothing is out of sorts here. Nothing at all.
I... well I didn't mean to give the impression that... Oh, hell with it. It looks like you know already. There's something under my house.
See, we were digging a... uh... storage place behind the bookcase and down... well, to hide things from the city guards. It didn't pan out, though.
Please... I've already told all I can... I just want people to leave my home. Just leave me... It's no secret anymore.
Farewell.
Has anyone left recently?
Bye bye.
I just have a few questions.
Me just gots some questions for yous.
Anyone get let out in last little while?
Me works for Aribeth and Nasher guy. You let me go.
I serve Aribeth and Lord Nasher. Let me pass.
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Well, has anyone been allowed in, then?
Hold! Passage from the city of Neverwinter is forbidden. We cannot risk the plague being spread to the surrounding countryside.
Well met, citizen.
No one has exited the city recently. I would not allow it. The danger to the outside lands is too great.
I don't care if you're the bloody avatar of Ilmater himself, you're not getting through this gate. Nobody passes this point until a cure is found.
What, did you not understand what I just said? Passage outside if forbidden. That means no one, and I mean NO ONE gets out.
I am trusted with the grave duty of keeping the whole of the North free of plague and you want to chat me up?
Please, just leave me to my duty. I can't lose focus. I can't let anyone gain my favor. Everyone is to be treated the same. Nobody gets out.
Er... I suppose I am not specifically restricted from letting people into the city. They are warned of the danger, but it is their risk to take.
That being said, nobody has entered the city recently. In fact, I believe only Desther and his Helmite brethren have dared risk it, and that was shortly after the plague began.
They have been tirelessly helping ever since. It's an astounding level of sacrifice for them to make, risking themselves like that.
Hello, I am <FullName>. Could I ask some questions?
I'm <FullName>. I have some questions.
I'm <FullName>. Just shut up and answer my questions.
Me <FullName>. Maybe me ask you some things?
Me <FullName>. You just shuts up and answer questions, okay?

What your job here?
