I will help.
Me help!
I have no interest in this.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You must agree that I am worth more.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You knows me worth more than that.
I demand more! Deny me and you will suffer!
Me wants more, or me hurt you bad!
That is sufficient. Thank you.
That really good. Thanks for the stuff.
That will not do! I demand more!
Farewell
Bye bye
What is the purpose of the zoo?
Why they cage animals?
I need the key.
Me need key.
I need the scroll.
Me need scroll.
Nothing more. Goodbye.
Perhaps more for a <brother/sister> druid?
What animals? Is there something you need help with?
What animals? Maybe you need help or something?
Greetings. Blessings of the Earthmother Chauntea and the Treefather Silvanus upon you. I am Nyatar, in the service of Nature.
Walk with balance and with nature.
I welcome your well-mannered address. Ask what you will, and I shall respond as I am able.
I will assist if I can, but mind your tone in the presence of nature. I favor balance in all things, including within those people I must associate with.
I will try to answer, though I cannot guarantee you will fully understand my replies. Your mind seems very... instinctual.
And I have no small stake in the fate of this city. The plague is not natural. I cannot be elsewhere when such an abomination goes unchecked.
The place of Nature is everywhere. It cannot be bound by walls or notions of property. Even in the heart of Neverwinter she must find purchase.
Nature's place is everywhere. It is the city that has encroached upon *her*. I work for balance, but I will not parade my methods for you to mock.
Especially in this time, when the population has been so weakened by the plague. Balance is the first casualty as people lose hope.
It kills the spirit. Victims rot from within as their very life is drained away... but where does it go? There is actually energy being lost here!
I see to it that the city does not tip too far from balance; that concerns for natural elements are kept a priority. *Sigh* It's not easy in these times.
You would not understand. Only a <brother/sister> in nature could fully appreciate what needs to be done. How vital my task is.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No, while I appreciate your offer, this would best be left to someone more inclined to understand balance.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Perhaps I was too quick to judge. You seem sincere enough. You may be able to understand why this is so important.
You... you are a ranger, are you not? I cannot be wrong; I know a <brother/sister> of the wood when I see one. You will understand.
You are a <brother/sister> druid, are you not? I cannot be mistaken. We are kin in the eyes of the Earthmother. You will understand.
Many people are falling to plague, but animals suffer as well. They suffer in cages, in a Blacklake district lodge. There is a zoo in Neverwinter.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No, understanding nature requires someone that is better at... understanding things.
It is operated by a hunter and his "noble" entourage. It is not clean, it is not compassionate, and it is not right. The animals within are mistreated.
Greetings again, <CUSTOM750>. Nature welcomes you. I hope the day has held you in better health than those poor creatures in the Blacklake zoo.
Greetings. Are you with <CUSTOM750>? The fight against the zoo in the Blacklake could use whatever help is available. The animals suffer so.
Your attitude is the majority. I was working to have it closed, but the plague has delayed that indefinitely. The officials I spoke with are among the plague dead.
It is not new. I was working to have it closed, but the plague has delayed that indefinitely. The officials I spoke with are among the plague dead.
It has given the zoo a reprieve. They know the law was turning against them, but now they have time to cover their actions.
I fear the animals will simply be killed and made into trophies. All creatures deserve charity. This bear, panther, wolf and lion; all four should be rescued.
Montgomery "Sureshot" Weatherson. His family has been a great advocate of animal rights, but Montgomery abandoned that philosophy when his father died.
I understand your reluctance in this troublesome time, but these little things make a diffence too. Please, take this in case you change your mind.
He gauges his progress as a man by what he has mastered, his family and business, and nature, creature by creature. He is out of balance.
This key will grant access to the zoo. My animal companion "found it," and I made copies. Guards may try to stop you, but doors will not.
This is a Transport Via Plants scroll. Use it on the large tree near the zoo and any of the animals you lead there will be teleported here.
I was hoping you would say that. Let me give you a few things to help in your task. I have thought long about what is required.
The plague still rages, but some small comfort has been given. Animals are no longer caged in that horrible zoo.
That is good to know. Truth be told, my animal spies have kept me informed. I have felt it necessary to carefully monitor the creatures involved.
Please, accept this reward with my blessing and that of the Earthmother and Treefather.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Perhaps I could grant a bit more of nature's blessing upon you, but I cannot make this allowance again.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I do not wish to downplay your role, but the proper reward was given. Appreciate that, and take pride in your service.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No, no I think you are... confused. No, the proper reward was given. Be happy with that, and take pride in your service.
Thank you for your assistance, <CUSTOM750>. You were invaluable.
<CUSTOM750>'s assistance was invaluable. A little balance given to this horrible time.
You have served the Earthmother and Treefather as well as could be done.
This Ironwood is as much as I can manage. The temple is severely strained in this time.
It is ignorant and downright criminal to make such demands! You must realize how unbalanced your actions are!
I... I cannot fight you... If I was strong enough I wouldn't have needed you in the first place. Take it... take it all...
Several nobles live vicariously through him. Their influence protects him from what little pressure I have been able to apply thorugh the law.
In nature, everything that falls away is reborn elsewhere, but this Wailing steals away the very core of a person like a bandit. That is NOT natural.
They claim they want common people to see the beauty of nature but, in truth, only the families of certain nobles are allowed in.
There are humane ways to do such things, but I suspect this zoo is more intended to show their superiority over the creatures held there.
For all the care they give to the animals held within, they may as well have simply placed their heads on the walls.
Please, speak with these animals as I know you can. Lead them to freedom at the large tree before their lives are lost. There is no purpose to their captivity.
And take this Scented Fetish. It will let you speak to the animals with the skill of a druid or a ranger. Please, lead the animals to the large tree and freedom.
I am glad to hear it. I previously gave out a key for the zoo and a Transport Via Plants scroll. Do you need these?
Please keep it in mind. I previously gave out a key for the zoo and a Transport Via Plants scroll. If you don't have them, take them just in case.
Please, use the fetish I made to lead the animals to freedom. There is no point to their captivity. They don't need to suffer.
Take it. My animal companion "found it" and I made copies.
I created it specifically for the large tree near the zoo. Please, free the animals.
All the animals were indeed freed, but the deaths suffered among those creatures has given this task a horrible end.
All the animals are free and safe. A pity about the deaths among their captors. All life deserves a chance... but perhaps that was their chance.
There has been some movement, but not all of the animals are safe. Please, if there is something you can do to help, this is the time.
They are all dead. You can't call this a success, can you? I can't. I was hoping for a bright spot amidst the plague...
Some animals escaped, at least. That is something. A little life in this horrible dying time. I'm not completely happy, but it's something.
At least only one of the animals was killed. That can be called a victory of sorts. Amidst everything else, there is a victory for life here.
Please, leave me. I am in no mood to speak. This is a tragedy.
Everything is dying. people... the animals... There's not much a person can do... is there?
Please, leave me be. I have no desire to speak with anyone.
I previously gave out a key for the zoo and a scroll of Trasport Via Plants. Do you need either of these to continue?
I want to grant you a reward for what was done, but you'll understand that I can't be too generous. This matter was not handled as well as it could have.
I would call the encounter a success, and must reward you accordingly. I am sure you will be pleased.
Here, with my blessing. I'm sure you will be pleased. Your service has been quite adequate.
Accept this reward and be thankful. Our association has been a trying one.
Take this, then, and leave. With nature's grace, we will have no further association.
Perhaps that can be arranged. I would not press the matter, however, as times are very lean. Take this, and go with balance.
This outpost will close over this... even nature's children must pay certain people to maintain our position in the city... even we...
I don't like it here. The animals seem sad. I can kind of tell. Maybe I'll help them when I'm bigger.
Time to go... goood. Gotta get out before those guards come. They scare me.
I wish they'd open the cages. Then we could cut the animals up for meat and stuff! Maybe even keep their heads!
Aw, I don't wanna go! I wanna see the guards kill somebody for being here too late!
I'll pay your one gold.
I'm not going to pay right now.
Montgomery "Sureshot" Weatherson bids you welcome to his animal hold. View these beasts for only one gold.
You may enter. Remember that you are a guest and must abide by the rules of common courtesy. The guards do not listen to excuses.
Then you don't get in. Goodbye.
Keep your manners while here. Your gold buys you a look and that's it. You should feel privileged that we work to stay open around the clock in these dangerous times.
Nightfall is coming. I warn you, the night guards do not listen to excuses. Get yourself gone or get ready to fight and die.
You've got some nerve! I've never backed down from a challenge!
Montgomery Sureshot will not let some damned treehuggers take his hard won trophies!
Nasher couldn't shut me down, Nyatar couldn't shut me down! What makes you think you can?
Not a one! Not a one goes free!
Now that's a fine animal! You'd have a fight running that one down. Get a good look, son!
I'll take you hunting one day, son. You'll love it! Face to face with the worst of nature's snarling beasts!
Can I kill it, dad?
Get lost. Can't you see I'm spending a day with the family?! Stare right into its eyes, boys. Show no fear!
I don't wanna. It looks sick.
Dear, you're scaring the children.
That's the spirit, but save it for the hike next week. We'll find some real trophies.
Time to go. That Montgomery isn't shy about setting his guards on people. That's a man that knows how to protect his home!
See that! It thinks you're food! Go on! Give it your arm!
Shut up! Stop it! It's sad... I can tell... I think...
A fine collection. Reminds me of my days with the Adaron Aces. I tell you, we would wrangle the biggest meanest... eh... what was it we hunted?
Not like the old days... never dared to put things in cages back then. These beasts look cowed... frightened. Where's the honor in a fight with one of these?
Time to head out. The guards have orders to... "deal" with anyone if the back rooms are tampered with.
Boar! That was it! Nasty things! Ah, those were the days... these beasts here look a bit underfed, though... not much challenge here.
*Sigh* I wish we didn't have to come here so often, but since the plague, Billiam hasn't been able to take the boys hunting. Not that I mind... so much blood...
I don't think it's safe to be here. Let's get out before those guards start threatening. They are the real beasts.
Wait here until I use Nyatar's scroll on the tree outside.
Take revenge on the guards! Slaughter them!
Take revenge on everyone! Slaughter anyone here!
Run to the tree outside. It will send you to freedom!
You are free. Wait until I make sure the way is safe.
<StartAction>This animal looks up slowly, unsure of your intent. You sense fear.</Start>
<StartAction>The animal nods, hoping you will come back soon. You sense worry.</Start>
<StartAction>The animal remembers the pain it has suffered. You sense rage.</Start>
<StartAction>The animal is overcome by a blind fury. You sense no restraint to its rage.</Start>
<StartAction>The animal is instantly more lively. You sense great joy.</Start>
I will listen. What is it you wish to say?
What do you want?
Speak, but waste my time and you'll regret it.
What you meaning? You please e'splain.
What you blather about, idiot?
Farewell for now.
Bye bye for nows.
I do what needs to be done. What is your offer?
Me does whatever. What you want?
Me nots evil!
I do not commit evil acts!
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me bad inside where good can't see!
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> My evil is carefully veiled, making me more dangerous!
You wish me to bring them to you instead of Oleff?
You wants me to bring to you instead of Oleff?
Even in times of plague you scheme. How petty.
Even with plague around you act mean. Stupid.
I will bring the artifacts to you instead of Oleff.
Me bring stuff to yous instead of Oleff stuffed-shirt.
Why do you think I am working for Oleff?
Why you think me work for Oleff?
No! Me demands more!
The letter is unimportant. I don't need it.
Letter dumb. Me not need.
Me not care about this.
Go over what is needed again.
You repeat stuff about this job, okay?
Farewell for now.
Bye bye for now.
Yeah yeah, I'll look into it sometime.
Me get around to it maybe later.
Go over the task with me. Perhaps I will help too.
You tell me stuff too. Maybe me help.
This doesn't interest me. Farewell.
Me not care much. Bye.
Me gots stuff from one of the tomb-things.
I have an artifact from one of the tombs.
I have no interest in this.
<StartAction>Describe the recovery of the Ancient Chronicles of Never.</Start>
<StartAction>Describe the recovery of Halueth Never's rusted armor.</Start>
Nevermind.
<StartAction>Describe the recovery of the Ancient Holy Symbol of Tyr.</Start>
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You must agree that I am worth more.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You knows me worth more than that.
I demand more! Appease me or die!
Me get more or you die like dog!
Me come back if find more, okay.
That is sufficient. Thank you.
That really good. Thanks for the stuff.
I shall return if I find more.
That will not do! I demand more!
You were at the tomb and didn't help the dying?
You was there and didn't help the dying guys?
That's despicable! Give me Jacob's quill NOW!
You evil dumb-head! Give me Jacob's write-y thing NOW!
Give me the Quill now, you evil bastard!
You gives me Quill right now, jerk!
What are the tenets of your faith in Talona?
What Talona? What she stand for?
I sense the stink of Tyr upon you. I hear that Oleff has you running errands? Maybe it displeases you? Care to hear an offer?
Off you go. Puppet. Dog.
Oh so polite. Bah! I have no use for manners. Can you steal and can you kill? That's what I need.
Ahh, you answer rude and rough. Are you what I need? Can you steal and kill? Or are you an indignant lackey of Tyr? We shall see.
Bah! Why I waste time on an imbecile, I don't know. Still, you don't need to think. You just need to steal and kill.
I'm sure your quaint morality lets you sleep deep and long. Come back when you tire of being an errand <boy/girl> for Tyr and Oleff.
The "justice" of Tyr has a sickening grip on this city. Talona would like to see... something happen. Something that will shake the Tyrran faith.
Wait... you... you reek of purity! You walk as a paladin! Bah! I waste my breath! There is nothing you can offer me!
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I'd be a fool to believe you! Your very nature makes you my enemy! Get lost.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Ahh, I see. I can respect that, but you'll have the taint of evil on you after this, I promise.
My name is Gilles. I need someone to act without conscience and despoil what the Tyrrans are trying to achieve. You see where I'm going?
You were given a letter by Oleff asking you to find certain tombs and the artifacts within. The fool wants to strengthen the will of the people.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No, I think it shall be left someone more appropriate, someone with adequate... eh... faculties.
These relics of Halueth Never could benefit the church of Talona, perhaps be warped to her will. And if not, they should be destroyed.
Hello again, <CUSTOM712>. Is there something you require? I hope you are not attracting attention to me for no reason.
Who in the hells are you? That <CUSTOM712> better not have said to talk to me. Too much attention is deadly.
Well now, wouldn't Oleff like to get his hands on this, hmm? I shall see that it is... properly disposed of.
Talona is her most active while people languish beneath disease. That is her domain, no matter if she caused the plague or not.
Oleff and his brethren have no guarantees that these items will stop the plague. They just know they could prove powerful.
This is a resource that must be denied them. Bring the items to me instead of Oleff and I will pay you far more than what he would've.
I have eyes around the city. They say you carry a letter from Oleff, compelling his fellow Tyrrans to let you pass.
What I don't know is whether you are helping for faith or just for the gold. If it's gold, I can offer more. It's that simple.
Of course you will. You understand how weak those fools are, and how they don't appreciate you. I will treat you right.
Have you found any of the Halueth Never artifacts? The followers of Talona long for them. Tyr will not have his trinkets.
Eh, you do not appear to have the letter that Oleff gave you. Have you rightfully abandoned his service?
Good, good. Just so long as you are still on the proper course. Talona has little patience for your mortal whims.
Ah HA! But I have planted the seed, and you will think about it each time you are underpaid by Oleff.
Ahh, but you have a copy of Oleff's letter too, don't you? Perhaps you have wisely decided to serve Talona?
What, are you supposed to be extra help or something? What weakling needs help against the plague-riddled Tyrrans?
You treat this task as though it is a mere errand! Show respect for the will of Talona! Get to your task!
Don't pester me unless you have news of benefit to the followers of Talona! Do not tempt her wrath!
The very shell that Halueth Never wore! The stink of him is thick inside it. My masters shall see that it is put to good use.
Well hand it over, fool! I'm not paying for your oh so eloquent words!
The Lady of Poison will not suffer these distractions. Get to your task!
Self-indulgent tripe! These chronicles will make fine kindling at the next gathering of malagents at Daernuth. What a festival that shall be!
Here, your pay is 600 gold. That is far more than what Oleff would pay, and I may give even more!
A victory! Tyr shall never know these things! Whatever the future brings, Talona shall always have this sweet spiteful victory!
A triumph! Forever a void in their knowledge of Halueth! Such a triumph for the Lady of Poison, but there is still more to find.
Take this additional 600, and know that Talona may spare you. That is all that can be asked!
There are further artifacts. Bring them to me and I shall reward your black soul with gold to bathe in! And more when they are all delivered!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> You're service was greatly appreciated, so I suppose more is warranted, but this boon shall NOT be repeated.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> You were paid what you were worth! Now you risk angering the Lady of Poison! No more shall be given!
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> You are an imbecile to demand more of Talona! There will be no further reward! Get lost!
Talona recognizes your worth. Go with your life.
Take this weapon, and no more. Ask for any further and you will risk the Lady of Poison's fury!
Talona will not accept these demands! You get nothing, and risk death on top of it! Be grateful for your life and leave!
Then die for your insult! My brethren are everywhere!
Perhaps we'll forge it into a shovel and make a gift of it to the city stables. That would be fitting.
Besides, I visited the dig in the Peninsula district. They need to hire outsiders like you. Their own brethren are falling like flies.
Go on with you, I got no reason to talk and you've got no reason to ask.
Not everyone is as stupid as you. I have spies and they say you have a letter from Oleff. You don't look like you deliver his mail.
Well, I helped myself to some of their belongings. Got a fine quill off one of them. Jacob was his name, I think.
He won't be needing it. I assume he's dead. He didn't react much when I rolled him over to go through his pockets.
Take this path and I'm gone for good, fool! Walk in their shadow or walk with me! Either way, this is never mentioned again! Choose!
Hmph! Puppet! Peon! Shove your trinket, your morals, and your blind righteousness where the light of Tyr doesn't shine!
I will wait here. Think of your worth, and I will be waiting here.
Bring me their "holy artifacts." They will be despoiled and twisted. Your evil intent is a welcome addition to our cause.
The Lady of Poison revels in disease and all that corrupts the body. She is at her greatest when all others are laid low.
That said... this plague is not her doing, though we are quite happy to accept tribute from people trying to appease her anyway.
Talona is life and death in balance, but death is the stronger. She is to be worshipped and feared, lest she strike you down when you are weakest.
Talona awaits.
You know a Moonstone Mask woman? Tamora?
You knows moonstone Mask woman. Tamora?
Nothing. Farewell.
Nothing. Nevermind. Byes.
See this brooch? Hers. And now you die!
Me gots her brooch. Me kill yous for her!
See her brooch? Good. Now I rough you up!
Me gots brooch from her! Now me kick yous butt!
No deal. You die!
No! You come near her again, you'll be sorry!!
No ways! You trouble her, you be sorry!!
I'm listening. What's your offer?
Me maybe listen. What you gots?
You are just evil. I like that. I'll take it.
Hehe, that pretty slimy. Hehe. You got deal.
Get lost. I don't know you. We got no reason to talk.
What do you want? I ain't got nothing to say to no strangers. Probably muggers and crap.
Just leave me be! I ain't going near that woman again! it just ain't worth it!
Heh! Tamora will just be furious that I have her brooch. Furious! I love it. What a tart.
Idiot.
Maybe. She's a fine little bint. Likes it when you treat her like garbage. Oh, wait, no. *I* like it when I treat her like garbage. Ha!
What's it to you? She send you to do something about it? Hah! I don't believe it.
Hey hey HEY! Just hold on! Maybe we can make a deal? Or something? Here, look, maybe you want gold?
All right, all right! She isn't worth it! Yeesh!
I thought so. You wouldn't have met her in the first place if you were pure and all that.
Here, I'll pay you 200 gold for her brooch. I got the money to spare, and it will drive her nuts that I have it. Hehe.
Wow, in the books it's a lot harder to corrupt people. You got a deal, friend. She'll be livid. That little strumpet. She loves it.
I would speak with you... and perhaps more.
Me talk with yous? Maybe more?
Goodbye.
<StartAction>Bemoan about how no one really respects you.</Start>
Let's talk about you, and what you like.
You listen well? Does talking make your "clients" more relaxed?
Perhaps I could ask some serious questions?
We talk about you. You pretty.
You listen? Talking make customers feel more happy?
Maybe me ask serious stuffs, okay?
Where are you from? What is your story?
Where you from? What your story?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> I'd find it degrading to disguise my true self like that.
I want to talk about something else.
Me talk about different things.
<StartAction>Lament the inherent loneliness of the adventurer lifestyle.</Start>
Nothing bothers me. I am strong.
Me strong. Nothing hurt me.
Whatever, harlot. I'm not here to talk.
Shaddap. Me not here for words, lap-lady.
There's more than talking, right?
We not just talk, right?
Here is a Pass Coin. My name is <FirstName>.
Here my Pass Coin. Me called <FirstName>.
I don't have a Pass Coin.
Me not gots Pass Coin.
I should be going.
Me should go, maybe.
I'll stay a while, I think.
Me not so dumb. Me stay.
I must leave. Farewell.
Me gots to go. Bye.
Perhaps we could... retire to your bedchambers, my lady?
Maybe we go sleep now? Nicely, I mean.
Let's knock boots, honey!
Let's make two-butt beast!
What do you know of the plague?
Know anything about plague?
Shouldn't you be ashamed of working here?
You feel dirty? Maybe ashamed?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> That's very selfless, giving of yourself like that.
A prostitute with a heart of gold. Oh, that's new.
Lap-lady with the heart of gold. That really new.
Don't make me go upside your head!
<StartAction>Confide that you might have a big role in curing the plague.</Start>
I enjoyed our time together. I hope you did as well.
Me like you. Hope you like me a little.
Another notch on my sword, woman. Nothing more.
You just one more for the road. Ha!
Welcome to the Moonstone Mask. My name is Luce. Is there aught I can do for you, gentle sir?
Good day, sir. My name is Luce. I trust you wish your visit to the Moonstone Mask to be a pleasant one.
Good day to you... fine sir. My name is Luce. Take heart. We of the Moonstone Mask are skilled at looking for worth beneath any distasteful surface.
Well, aren't you sweet, but remember that a Pass Coin only entitles you to my time. Anything beyond that is my discretion. I'm sure we'll get along fine, though.
Me? Tonight I am whatever you wish. I am a confidant and a friend, if that is what you need me to be.
Well, a long time ago I was born to a loving family. And now I am here with you. Nothing is more important than that right now.
Well, then it is fortunate that I am not you. I give comfort where it is needed. What do you do, besides malign the choices of others?
Goodbye. Perhaps we'll talk another time. Just remember to provide a Pass Coin. They are available from the bartender.
Important people are not often able to confide with people that care. I am a surrogate and a friend, if need be. Tell me, what bothers you?
Of course you feel that way. Many people in power have a sense of yearning that just can't seem to be filled, despite their great responsibilities.
You can let it all go with me. I am not here to judge, or to laud your position. I am here with you, stripped of your trappings.
How serious is "serious?" I try not to worry my companions unnecessarily, but I will endeavor to talk about whatever you like.
I am sure you are quite capable, but is your emotional armor so perfect? There is no shame in needing a kind word now and then.
For instance, you seem a roguish type. Irreverent. Perhaps someone that enjoys playing with people. Sometimes that can keep companions at a distance.
For instance, you look very in tune with nature. A good calling, but perhaps it keeps your companions at a distance?
For instance, you look very devout, and sure of your spiritual side. That can sometimes keep friends at a distance if they don't understand.
For instance, you seem very learned of arcane matters. Perhaps it sometimes keeps companions at a distance? Some people react with suspicion to such things.
For instance, you look like someone familiar in the use of weapons. That affinity for battle can keep companions at a distance sometimes.
I can close that distance, if you like. That's why I'm here, and likely that's why you are here too.
I am sorry, m'lady, but my company is open to males alone. You might wish to see if Tanith is free.
I think you should reconsider your tone. A Pass Coin purchases my time, not my will. If I am not pleased with your behavior, this encounter will end.
I will try to abide your gruff demeanor, but remember that a Pass Coin buys my time, not my will. If your words displease me, this encounter will end.
Very well, <FirstName>. Now, tell me a little something about yourself. What's on your mind? We are very good listeners here at the Mask.
Well, I regret to inform you that I cannnot speak with you unless you have one. I'm sorry. See the bartender if you wish to purchase one.
That is your option, but I must tell you that you will have to purchase another Pass Coin to speak with me again. Do you still wish to leave?
Another time, then. See the bartender for additional Pass Coins.
I thought you might. Shall we talk some more, perhaps?
I hardly think so. No, I have every right to refuse such a... distasteful advance. There is an art to this. You can't just charge like a bull.
Your simple charms suit you well. I like you, <FirstName>. You please me. Perhaps your suggestion is one we should... pursue?
Such a gentleman. You know, <FirstName>, I think I quite like you. I think your suggestion is worth pursuing.
Not just yet. Patience is a virtue. Perhaps we should spend a little more time getting to know each other.
Follow me, my dear. Let's leave these bright lights off for awhile.
Nothing, and I couldn't say if I did. Call it superstitious, but Ophala was very explicit in requesting that we don't talk of it.
This really isn't the time or place for such things. Let's get back to you, and what you need.
Of course. Our time can be spent any way that you wish. Within reason, of course. Mood is so important.
You're true to yourself, and you follow the path that you've chosen because it is right for you. That's the mark of a strong man.
Ehh... perhaps we should spend a little more time getting to know each other. A lot more. I don't judge, but you are working against your... rough exterior.
Look, if you want someone to kick you in the head there are special rooms for that in some of the dirtier dockside taverns.
My job is to listen and further a positive dialogue. If you don't want that, the door is behind you. Now... (ahem)... You were saying?
This talk is over. Get out before I call the guards.
No, I've been mistreated enough for today. I'm off. Go somewhere else.
Many people come here not knowing what it is they want. I try to make them comfortable. I try to ease what bothers them.
I'm done with you. That was hurtful and inappropriate.
Some people just need a sympathetic ear. More than you would think, actually. I hope I make a difference in their lives.
Shouldn't you reserve your judgment for your own actions? I stand before you unashamed. Who are you to project your fears on me?
Now, shall we return to our pleasant chat, or will you exercise your right to use the door behind you?
Well, that certainly is a lot of pressure. So many people relying on you, even if they don't know it. That must weigh on your mind.
I can't help you in whatever task you percieve is yours, <FirstName>, but I can try to ease your mind. I don't expect anything from you.
Sorry, I'm a bit tired today. I've been thinking of taking a little time off. Maybe doing some travelling or some such.
Ah, <FirstName>. I trust you are well? I hope I had some impact on you. Some people have trouble recognizing when they really need someone to talk to.
Perhaps one of the others can assist you? I'm sure they will be more than welcoming.
Yes, silly, I like you fine. Don't let people get you down saying you are... uh... slow. You're a charmer, you are.
<FirstName>, you are ever the perfect gentleman. You needn't worry. No judgments, remember?
<FirstName>, you a fine companion. I must admit that you seemed... unpolished when I first spoke with you, but your manner is deceiving. You are a gentleman.
I want to ask questions about the Moonstone Mask.
Me want some informations about Moonstone Mask.
Goodbye.
What do you know of the plague?
What kind of service is offered here?
What can you tell me about the owner of this place?
You know anything about the bad plague?
What they do here? What service you get?
Know anything about owner here?
What do you know about attempts at a cure?
You know about cure attempts maybe?
I want to ask something else.
Me ask different questions.
I don't work here. I've questions about the Moonstone Mask.
Me not work here. Me gots questions about Moonstone Mask.
I am not here for your amusement, dog!
Me not here for you, jerk.
Farewell.
Bye bye.

<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> What you almost say? Tell me, 's okay.

<StartCheck>[Flirt]</Start> Maybe yous can tell me? Hmmm, pretty boy?

You tell me, or me break yous head!
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Doesn't the plague discourage... close contact?

This a bad place! No good for good city!

Yes? Is there something you want? I usually only have time to speak with the ladies when I visit here.
Greetings to you. Here, stand a bit closer. I look positively dashing next to you.
Very well. Let me know if I go too fast for you.
Very well. I have a few moments. What is it?
Don't speak of that! People come here to get away from such talk. They might shut this place down if people get too worried.
Goodbye. Perhaps we'll talk another time.
Companionship, in whatever form that means to you. The employees here are adept in discourse, games, and are especially good at listening.
Suffice to say that she runs a clean, much needed establishment. You won't find anyone to badmouth her.
Ophala is a saint of a woman. Anyone saying otherwise had best keep a close eye on... well, this isn't for me to talk about.
Well, greetings to you, my fair, fair lady. Would you care to share my company awhile?
Hello there. Let's have a look at you. Nothing spectacular, but fair enough. Would you care to share my company?
No, no, no, you're not what I had in mind at all. Get yourself back under whatever rock you crawled from.
Fair day to you, ma'am.
Very well, though perhaps we'll discuss compensation later?
That's a relief. From your tone I was worried that Ophala might have lost her taste in companions. Leave me, then.
Ah, you're an intellectual charmer as well. Very well, I'll answer what I can.
Well, you certainly have a charming manner. Perhaps I can be a bit more... free with you. Very well.
Ehh, don't do that. You'lll put me off my supper. Sorry, but you're just not my... ah... type.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I suppose it wouldn't hurt. It's not like people don't know. They just don't talk about it.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No, I really don't want to be making an enemy of Ophala. She's a great source of... comfort in these times.
Ophala dabbles in... artful theft. She's arranged expensive losses for many of her detracters, though usually just as trophy victories.
It's a challenge to her, and I've heard of nobles playfully offering their homes as targets, though maybe they only say that after.
Okay, okay! It's not like she makes things a big secret, so there's no need to get violent. Take it easy.
She doesn't do it herself, of course. She hires subtle sneaksmen, though I hear the plague has taken her favorites.
They know a lot about everyone, and that knowledge keeps the Moonstone Mask from being closed by the more prudish of the community.
Bite your tongue! That would be the greatest tragedy of them all. Imagine the decline in morale from that!
No, Ophala has taken special precautions to avoid any such worries. You'll realize that, should you decide to... partake.
And by what authority do you speak? Your god? There are other gods. Your laws? There are other laws.
No one is here against their will. There is a prestige to this place, and many a great name has come just to talk with an attentive listener.
You won't get far around here if you damn things just because they personally offend you. That's intolerance, not morality.
Nothing, but I know that I won't live in fear. I will mourn, and I may die, but I will do it at the bar with my friends and in talented company.
Well hello. I am <FullName>. Will you answer some questions?
I'm <FullName>. I have a few questions.
I'm <FullName>. Just answer my questions.
Me <FullName>. Maybe me ask some questions?
Me <FullName>. You just answer questions and stop yappin'.
Farewell for now.
Bye bye, okay?
What kind of place do you run here?
What kind of stuff happens here?
Know any rumors? Seen anything strange?
Maybe you knows things? Seen weird stuffs?
You knows anything abouts the plague, maybe?
Have you heard anything about the plague?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You can trust me. What've you got to say?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Trust me, okies? Yeah, 's all good.
I will get them. Give me more details.
Me help get art stuff. Know where they is?
This does not interest me.
This is not my concern.
Tell me about these art objects.
So you want some pretty stuff? What is they?
No! Me demands more!
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You must agree that I am worth more.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You knows me worth more than that.
I demand more! Pay or prepare to suffer!
Me wants more, or me hurt you good!
That is sufficient. Thank you.
That really good. Thanks for the stuff.
I don't care! I demand more!
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> And if they stopped, you might have to sell those secrets.
Come now, madam. Don't keep secrets between us.
You pretty. Tell me stuff. No secrets.
I'm interested in the backroom.
Tell about backroom stuff for me. Yeah.
Don't play games. Tell me or shut the hell up.
Stupid word games! Just say or shut up!
I want permission to access the backrooms.
Me wants in backroom place. Sounds fun.
A common bawdy house! I am outraged!
Bunch o' harlots and jigg-o-lers! You sick!
I already have a writ from him. Here.
Me gots it already. Uh, the paper, not plague.
Thank you. I'll return directly.
Okies, me come back soon.
I have an art object you might be interested in.
Me gots art crap you might like.
<StartAction>Describe securing the Statuette from Androd Golden.</Start>
<StartAction>Describe securing the Portrait from Thoms Rumbottom.</Start>
<StartAction>Describe securing the Urn from Hodge.</Start>
Nothing. Nevermind.
I have a writ from Oleff declaring me plague free.
Me gots Oleff to say me not sick! Here paper!
This is nothing but a house of ill-repute!
This a dirty place! Filthy dirty!
What business do you need done?
You needs business or something done?
Well now, welcome to the Moonstone Mask. I am Ophala, your host and purveyor of fine spirits and entertainment.
Do come again. We're always open.
Well, you are quite the charmer, aren't you? Ask away.
My staff won't respond well to that attitude, you know. If you expect any quality of service you had better work on your tone.
I'll answer what I can. Just yell if I go too fast for you.
I won't have it spoken of within these walls. This is a place away from those... horrible concerns. Don't upset my customers, understand?
Look, you seem to be a likable person, so why don't you ask people yourself. It's not my business to tattle on my customers.
I have seen deals, secrets, and strange rendezvous, none of which are any business of yours. Please stay and enjoy, but stay out of people's... affairs.
There are... a few that are perhaps a bit unseemly, but everyone is welcome here. If I gave out secrets my customers would stop coming.
It's a place of comfort and understanding. That has different meanings to different people, so we have a wide variety of services.
I can't expect you to understand if this is your first visit. Most of what goes on here is quite innocent. Ah... most.
Perhaps you would be interested in partaking of our backroom areas? Or maybe you could be of use... no, I talk too freely.
Greetings to you again, <CUSTOM710>. Have you come to sample the delights of our company in the backroom, or is this about... business?
Greetings. Are you with <CUSTOM710>? They were the only other new person I've spent much time with lately. Is this visit for pleasure or business?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I suppose there's no harm in me telling you what I need. Maybe you can help, if you're good enough.
You see, I'm an avid... collector. My position here lets me hear about interesting things, and I occasionally hire people to get them for me.
Currently, I want a few pieces of art "liberated." The owners of them have made disparaging remarks about me, and I would like to express my displeasure.
One is a statuette of someone's mother, or some such. Lord Androd Golden has it at his estate. He lobbied to ban city guards from visiting the Moonstone Mask.
Listen anyway, so if you change your mind you will know where to go. The Rumbottom estate is in the Blacklake district. Androd's is in the Docks district.
Another is a portrait of Sir Reginald Rumbottom III. His nephew, Lord Thoms Rumbottom, has repeatedly lobbied to have us closed down. He's a bit... insecure, I think.
Last I heard, Hodge may have been in the Blacklake district. No doubt he's fortified himself in some noble's home, but I don't know which.
I'm not asking you to kill. Just bring me the items. I'll reward you well.
Excellent. The Rumbottom estate is in the Blacklake district, while Androd maintains a home in the Docks district. Both are notoriously paranoid.
That is the last of them. These items were very personal to me, and I am more than willing to sweeten what I have already paid.
Here, take this 400 gold and a little something special. You deserve it.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> You drive a hard bargain, but I suppose it was worth it. This was a headache I am glad to have cured.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I do not wish to downplay your role, but the proper reward was given. Appreciate that, and take pride in your service.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I would not want to make light of your... mental condition, but you are wrong. I paid you what you deserved.
Please, feel free to spend some of your reward in the backroom. Provided you have met the conditions for entry, of course. Feel free to ask.
This diamond is all that I can afford. The plague has really cut into our clientele.
I'm not a big fan of appeasement as a means to deter threats. I'd ask that you look around and carefully consider your position.
Tsk. So be it. The people I meet. Yeesh.
The last is an urn stolen from me some years ago. The man that took it apparently got stuck here in the quarantine. Hodge is his name.
I am especially happy to see that women are visiting. As you can see, it seems that men are more inclined to seek comfort here in times of crisis.
You'll have stiff competition for attention tonight, I fear. Many more men than women are seeking comfort here tonight, it seems.
You could view it that way. It's in their best interests to behave while here, and it's in my best interests to keep close tabs when they don't.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No, I need someone I can trust. I'm happy to wait.
Well, aren't you just the cutest little buffoon. Very well, I'll tell you what I need and you can decide if you can help.
You've certainly got a silver tongue. Almost good enough for my backroom. How about I tell you what I need, and you decide if you can help.
You'd have to be an exceptional specimen for that to work on me. You're an amateur compared to my men in the back.
There's no need for that tone! I suppose... I suppose I do need a rougher kind of person. I don't have to like it, though.
If you agree, I'll tell you what I know about their whereabouts. Keep in mind that if I had exact information, I wouldn't need you.
Well, we have many pleasant employees that are willing to offer their comfort and sympathy to you in this troubled time.
They can cater to both men and women, and are quite skilled at conversation, artful pursuits, and many other forms of diversion.
The level of interaction must be agreed to by both parties, and there is the small matter of compensation for the time spent, as well.
Look, there is nothing going on here but the consensual exchange of gold for service. Besides, most people just want to talk.
I'd suggest you control your outbursts if you wish to remain in my good graces. I've no patience for false purity.
I'm sure you do. Very well. First, you will need a writ from Oleff in the Temple of Tyr, certifying you are plague free. Just a precaution, you understand.
Return to me when you have it and I will grant you a key... as well as take your 200 gold donation. Pretty standard fare.
Eh, from the state of you, I'd have him look for Footman's Trouser Gout as well. Can't be too careful in this day and age.
Here is the paper. Oleff will recognize it. I'll make sure there is room in the back for you. Hurry back.
Well, when you phrase it like that, how can I not be intrigured. I was looking for a number of things. What have you got?
You do? I have been looking for a few things. Tell me what it is that you have?
Please don't tease me so. I have ever so many empolyees that do it better than you.
Very good. I never did like his work, but I certainly couldn't allow him to retain this piece. Especially not since things soured between us.
I appreciate that you brought it, but the murder of Androd was wholly unnecessary! I heard about what a bloody matter it was!
Thank you. I never cared for his uncle, but Thoms had this painted on some rather sensitive parchment. I couldn't leave it in his care.
The portrait is painted on a rather sensitive document, but that was no excuse for killing Thoms. He was no fighter.
There's no real value to the urn, but I love messing with Hodge. If you happened to spoil some scheme he was working on, all the better.
Here, I'll pay you now for this piece. Excellent work. 400 gold should satisfy your pockets.
I'm paying less for this bungled affair. You should have restrained yourself. 200 gold is what you get.
There is more for you to retrieve. Return when you have it and I'll reward you. I'll give more when all three objects are in my possession, as well.
Besides, this might get him off my back. He doesn't care much for the Moonstone Mask. I think he's... got a condition.
He probably didn't even know there was anything wrong with the painting, and he didn't deserve to die for simply opposing the Moonstone Mask.
Well that seems to be just fine. Yes, yes I think you'll be all right. I'll gladly give you a key to the backroom.
There is just the small matter of a Pass Coin. Purchase one and you can spend as long as you like with one of our friendly staff.
You can get the coins from the bartender for 200 gold. Remember to be on your best behavior. The coins buy you time, not consent. Only gentle persuasion grants that.
Begging your pardon, but don't you already have a key to the back room? All you need now is to purchase Pass Coins from the bartender.
Well, my concerns are my own, but perhaps you could be useful... I don't know though.
Just take the paper you have. Oleff will recognize it. I'll make sure there is room in the back for you. Hurry back.
I would speak with you... and perhaps more.
Me talk with yous? Maybe more?
Goodbye.
<StartAction>Bemoan about how no one really respects you.</Start>
Let's talk about you, and what you like.
You listen well? Does talking make your "clients" more relaxed?
Perhaps I could ask some serious questions?
We talk about you. You pretty.

Maybe me ask serious stuffs, okay?
Where are you from? What is your story?
Where you from? What your story?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> I'd find it degrading to disguise my true self like that.
I want to talk about something else.
Me talk about different things.

Nothing bothers me. I am strong.

Here my Pass Coin. Me called <FirstName>.

Me should go, maybe.

Me not so dumb. Me stay.

Maybe we go sleep now? Nicely, I mean.
Let's knock boots, honey!
Let's make two-butt beast!

Know anything about plague?
Shouldn't you be ashamed of working here?
You feel dirty? Maybe ashamed?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> That's very selfless, giving of yourself like that.
Harsh. Aren't you supposed to have a heart of gold?
Harsh. Where's your heart of gold and stuff?
<StartAction>Confide that you might have a big role in curing the plague.</Start>
What's that about your other clients?
You gots problems with someone?
You're having problems? Perhaps it *should* be my business.
You gots trouble? Maybe it good me help, maybe?
Don't tease! Tell me about your client or shut the hell up!
Stupid! Say about client or be more quiets!
What's in it for me?
What me get?
Perhaps I can look into it. I'll see.
Maybe me try find this jerk.
I'll maybe take a look. Now, about that chat?

I'll just go look into this.
Me go check it out.
I'm here as a Moonstone Mask customer.
Me here for pretty ladies. Heeh.
What business do you mean? Are you having trouble?
I'm here about the business with Hoff.
Me here about Hoff.
What business you mean? Me don't get it.
I hope you enjoyed our time together.
Hope you happy. Me happy if you happy.
Like I care? You're another notch on my sword.
Heh... me not care. Got what me wanted.
Goodbye.
Here's your brooch. Hoff doesn't have it.
Here brooch. Hoff gots nothing.
Hoff is dead. Here is your brooch.
Hoff whack dead! Here your brooch.
Sorry to hear that.
That too bad.
He's dead. Here's your brooch.

Nothing.
He's scared now. Here's your brooch.
He scaredy-baby now. Here your brooch.
Well good. Now, how about some chatting?
Good then. Now maybe we "talk."
Well, welcome to the Moonstone Mask, handsome stranger! I'm Tamora, and I'll be your dream for the evening. Won't you be mine?
Greetings and such. I'm Tamora. What can the friendly staff of the Moonstone Mask do for you today?
Whoop. No sir, Tamora ain't doing charity cases today. The Moonstone Mask is judgment free, but I got eyes. You ugly.
Wow, ever the gent. Not like some other jerks. Well, pony up a Pass Coin and you have my time. More than that... we'll see.
Me? This really isn't about me. I'm what you want, and nothing more. Besides, can you believe anything I say when you're paying for it?
Doesn't really matter, does it? I'm from here. I'll be here long enough for you. Let's be happy with that. I am.
Too bad for you, I guess. People hide from each other all the time. I just tell you about it upfront.
Bye then. If you come back, make sure you bring a Pass Coin. I can't say all that much, otherwise.
I guess. It's more to see whether I like them or not. They confide and I show them support. Do you need that sort of thing? What bothers you?
Well, you might have reason to feel that way. Maybe you deserve it. I don't know. I never really understood how some people can have so much and still be empty.
I'm not here to judge or anything. I mean, everyone needs sympathy, no matter how much they enjoy their life.
Not likely. I don't let things get to me. Not usually, anyway. People really have to try to get under my skin.
Tough talk, but I know a lot of guys that act like that, but turn out to be big kittens. What about you?
Maybe you feel lonely or not as well-liked as you should be? It's not like you don't need companions. You came here, didn't you?
Of course, you could just be here because you don't need the pain of trying to work through real relationships. No shame in that.
Sorry little lady, I'm not your type. You'll have to go talk to Tanith. He's a big sweety.
Oh, a tough guy. I have enough clients like that, but that ain't your business. You want my time? Get a Pass Coin and an attitude adjustment.
Maybe, if you are less of a jerk. I've had enough from... well, enough of that. Pony up a Pass Coin and we'll start with a little chat.
Very well, <FirstName>. Now, tell me a little something about yourself. What's on your mind? I listen well enough, if that's what you want.
What, I'm supposed to talk for free? I don't think so. Pay the bartender for the Coins. He's got plenty.
If you want, but you can't just start back where we leave off. If you come back, you'll have to pay again. So, you going?
Another time, then. See the bartender for additional Pass Coins.
Well good. Let's chat a little more. You've got some interesting things to say. Really. I mean that. Yeah.
Slow down! This ain't a calf roping. You charge ahead and the only thing you'll get is my foot in your butt. Trust me, you wouldn't like it.
You are a lovable little simpleton, ain't you. I like you, <FirstName>. I like you just fine. Let's have a little fun, you and me.
Such a gentleman. You know, <FirstName>, I think I quite like you. I think your suggestion is worth pursuing.
Let's talk a bit more. You aren't the type to move too fast, are you? Nah, you want to last awhile. Let's talk some more.
Follow me. We'll put the lights out for a while.
Whoa, none of that. Ophala doesn't want it spoken of in here. Figures that would be like inviting it in.
Of course. We can talk all night, if you want. Your coin is in the bank and there's no one beating down the door.
Ehh... perhaps we should spend a little more time getting to know each other. A lot more. I don't judge, but you are working against your... rough exterior.
Hah! Whatever. I'm here because the money is good. It's really good. Nice people, too... mostly. The ones that aren't will get dealt with.
I get people talking, loosen them up a bit, and maybe we spend some time in the dark. It's like life, but less of a burden. Beats farming.
I suppose. I don't think about it. I just like putting on the masks. Not everyone wants a deep chat about life, either.
And some people just want to talk and don't care if the person really listens.
If I'm supposed to feel ashamed, what are you supposed to feel like? You're the one supporting the profession. No one forced you in here.
Now, shall we return to our pleasant chat, or will you exercise your right to use the door behind you?
What are you doing here, then? Yeesh. I mean, I'm sure it's a lot of pressure, but shouldn't you get to it?
If you're looking for some fun, I'm off the market for the moment. It's been a trying bunch of days, let me tell you.
Wow, you're a moron. Better than being a jerk like... well, enough of that. Pony up a Pass Coin and we'll have a little chat.
Ain't none of your business, as I said. Now, did you want some engaging discourse or are you just wasting my time?
You "not gots" a lot more than that, friend. The bartender can help you get some coins, but the rest... I don't know.
You'll help me? Right! Tell you what, I'll fill you in and we'll see just how much help you provide.
Not that being ugly is the worst thing. I'm just stressed enough dealing with one of the worst clients... But that ain't your business.
Well maybe I should just have you kicked out or... or maybe you're just the kind of jerk I need to deal with another jerk.
See, I've got this guy who's decided he really likes tormenting me. He follows me around and some of my good clients get threatened... that sort of thing.
Guy's name is Hoff. Hangs out at the Docks. Big controller. How about you give him a message? Preferably on the end of your boot.
I don't know. Applause? Look, if you want to do a good deed, go do it. I don't need to be in debt to another jerk.
Don't get to it soon or anything. Here, take this brooch so Hoff knows I sent you. Be careful with it! I want it back when you're done!
Now, I suppose we can spend a little time chatting first if you want, but I need this taken care of eventually.
You'd better take a look. I already gave you my brooch so Hoff knows I sent you. I'd better get it back when this is all done, too!
You'll need to track <CUSTOM621> down. He said he'd help too, and I gave the jerk my brooch so that Hoff would know I sent him!
Gee, thanks for that stirring pledge. Here, take my brooch so Hoff will know I sent you. Be careful! I want it back when all this is done!
You'd better! I already gave you my brooch so Hoff would recognize you! I want it back when all this is done, you know!
Thanks, but you'll have to track down <CUSTOM621> to do it. I already gave the jerk my brooch so Hoff would know I sent him.
I wouldn't have given it up if this wasn't important. That Hoff... I don't know about him. Remember, he's in the Docks somewhere.
I wouldn't have given it if this wasn't important. That Hoff... I don't know about him at all. Careful in the Docks when you are looking.
Thanks. Remember, he won't believe I did this if you don't have the brooch. Those Dock boys are thick skulled.
Nope, you is still ugly. I mean, I need your help, but that price is just too high. Maybe later if you help me just this once? Please?
Here, take this brooch so Hoff knows I sent you. Be careful with it! I want it back when this is done!
I mean, I already gave you my brooch so that Hoff knows I sent you. I'll want it back when all this is done, too.
You'll have to track down <CUSTOM621>. I gave the jerk my brooch so Hoff would know I sent him. I'll want it back when all this is done, too.
Hello there. You here for business or pleasure? Before you say "pleasure is your business," let me remind you that I'll kick you square if you do.
Whoa, I don't think so. I mean, it looks like they used your face to take the harsh edges off an ugly stick.
And your name was... ? Just kidding! Really, <FirstName>, it's nice of you to come back and say that. It is. You were fun.
And, I might add, you're a bit of good stuff. Your... determination and flexibilty are mightily impressive. Trust me.
Not the most creative of nights, but determination sure made up for any lack of... flexibility. Really.
And I wouldn't be concerned. Your impressive... flexible nature more than make up for any... ah... shortcomings. Really.
Nothing spectacular, maybe, but nice. Don't worry. No judging in the Moonstone Mask about any kind of... ah... shortcomings. Mostly.
Yeah, yeah, the first time always brings out the pathetic joker in some people. You don't impress me.
Oh, and what do you have to tell me?
Yes yes. Just leave me to my business.
Son of a bitch! Hoff got my brooch! That's the last time I trust anyone!
Whatever. I'm not talking to anyone anymore. I can't believe this!
Oh... soooo... someone sold it to him and then stole it back? I suppose that will teach him a lesson or something... I guess.
This is just confusing me. It's like people are going out of their way to make things difficult. I'm taking some time off. I don't know...
Don't tease me with this garbage.
More than I wanted... but I'm not going to shed a tear over him. He was a real jerk. Thanks.
Don't be expecting a great reward or anything. I don't have much beyond gratitude and a good thought.
That should keep him away then. Hopefully he doesn't start bugging anyone else. He might end up dead. That would be a shame.
Okay... sooo.... someone sold it to him and then killed him to get it back? I guess that's what I wanted.
Tsk. Nooooo, I don't think so. I'm just not feeling the love right now. Let's talk a bit more, and maybe you'll get a little friendlier?
Remember, no kissing.
I would speak with you... and perhaps more.
Me talk with yous? Maybe more?
Goodbye.
<StartAction>Bemoan about how no one really respects you.</Start>
Let's talk about you, and what you like.
You listen well? Does talking make your "clients" more relaxed?
Perhaps I could ask some serious questions?
We talk about you, handsome kinda guy.
You listen? Talking make customers feel more happy?
Maybe me ask serious stuffs, okay?
Where are you from? What is your story?
Where you from? What your story?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> I'd find it degrading to disguise my true self like that.
I want to talk about something else.
Me talk about different things.
<StartAction>Lament the inherent loneliness of the adventurer lifestyle.</Start>
Nothing bothers me. I am strong.
Me strong. Nothing hurt me.
Whatever, plaything. I'm not here to talk.
Shaddap. Me not here for words, lap-lad.
There's more than talking, right?
We not just talk, right?
Here is a Pass Coin. My name is <FirstName>.
Here my Pass Coin. Me called <FirstName>.
I don't have a Pass Coin.
Me not gots Pass Coin.
I should be going.
Me should go, maybe.
I'll stay a while, I think.
Me not so dumb. Me stay.
I must leave. Farewell.
Me gots to go. Bye.
Perhaps we could... retire to your bedchambers?
Maybe we go sleep now? Nicely, I mean.
Forget the talk. Let's wrassle!
Let's make two-butt beast!
What do you know of the plague?
Know anything about plague?
Shouldn't you be ashamed, working here?
You maybe ashamed of working here?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> That's very selfless, giving of yourself like that.
What *I* need? Right. You do this to help others. Ha!
Me not that stupid! You not here to help!
Don't make me go upside your head! I've always wanted to say that.
<StartAction>Confide that you might have a big role in curing the plague.</Start>
I enjoyed our time together. I hope you did as well.
Me like you. Hope you like me a little.
Just another victim, boy.
You one of many. Hehe. Me done with you.
Just lay with me. That is enough.
Maybe we just lay still. That good.
Gentle comforts are welcome. I'm not that tired.
Gentle night, maybe. Me not that tired.
I'm looking for an animal. Think you can manage?
Make me tired. Real tired. Animal man.
Welcome to the Moonstone Mask. I am Tanith. What would the lady like for this evening? What is your pleasure?
Good day, ma'am. I am Tanith. I shall endeavor to make your visit to the Moonstone Mask a pleasant one.
Well... good day... fine lady. My name is Tanith. I shall endeavor to be what you need in a companion... with no judgment... mostly.
I am certain, my lady, that we shall have a fine time. Have you a Pass Coin? A formality, as I am sure our talk will be... enjoyable.
Me? Tonight I am whatever you wish. I am a confidant and a friend, if that is what you need me to be.
I was raised in a home with five sisters. When I left, I didn't really fit in with the dock workers or loggers. I don't count that as a loss.
I understand. As a woman you may have been forced to hide your true feelings on occasion. I don't appreciate the tone of your comment, but I understand.
Goodbye. Perhaps we'll talk another time. Just remember to provide a Pass Coin. They are available from the bartender.
Important people are not often able to confide with people that care. I am a surrogate and a friend, if need be. Tell me, what bothers you?
Of course you feel that way. Many people in power have a sense of yearning that just can't seem to be filled, despite their great responsibilities.
You can let it all go with me. I am not here to judge, or to laud your position. I am here with you, stripped of your trappings.
If that is what you wish. I don't recommend it, but I will accomodate you as best I can.
I am sure you are quite capable, but is your armor so perfect? Women in power are sometimes convinced that need equals weakness.
For instance, you seem a roguish type. Irreverent. Perhaps someone that enjoys playing with people. Sometimes that can keep companions at a distance.
For instance, you look very in tune with nature. A good calling, but perhaps it keeps your companions at a distance?
For instance, you look very devout, and sure of your spiritual side. That can sometimes keep friends at a distance if they don't understand.
For instance, you seem very learned of arcane matters. Perhaps it sometimes keeps companions at a distance? Some people react with suspicion to such things.
For instance, you look like someone familiar in the use of weapons. That affinity for battle can be threatening, and keep people at a distance.
I can close that distance, if you like. That's why I'm here, and likely that's why you are here too.
I am sorry, m'lord, but my company is open to the ladies alone. You might wish to see if Tamora or Luce are available.
That tone will not do you much good here. A Pass Coin may purchase my time, but a line such as that is more at home on the tavern floor.
There's no need to be quite so.. gruff. Merely supply your Pass Coin and we will continue. I assume you will adopt a more pleasant voice?
Very well, <FirstName>. Now, tell me a little something about yourself. What's on your mind? We are very good listeners here at the Mask.
Well, I regret to inform you that I cannnot speak with you unless you have one. I'm sorry. See the bartender if you wish to purchase one.
That is your option, but I must tell you that you will have to purchase another Pass Coin to speak with me again. Do you still wish to leave?
Another time, then. See the bartender for additional Pass Coins.
I thought you might. Shall we talk some more, perhaps?
My dear, dear woman, I will be more than happy to accomodate you... eventually. Let's just... go a little slower. Gutter-talk can be had anywhere.
Your simple charms suit you well. I like you, <FirstName>, but let me first ask what it is you expect. I'll need to know my boundaries.
Such a lady. I would be open to that, <FirstName>, but let me first ask you what it is you expect. What my boundaries are.
Not just yet. i want a sense of who you are. I can't be properly attentive if I don't know you well enough.
What do you wish from me? How far should I go? Did you wish my simple arms for the night, or are you wanting more... masculine charms?
Sorry, but Ophala want's no talk of that. Call a devil's name and you invite him in. We want the Moonstone Mask to be an escape.
Of course. Our time can be spent any way that you wish. Within reason, of course. Mood is so important.
You're true to yourself, and you follow the path that you've chosen because it is right for you. That's the mark of a woman that understands what she needs.
Do not take this the wrong way but... my lady, I will need just a bit longer to bask in your... inner beauty first.
Look, if you want someone to fight with, you can look for an adversary outside. I will not be baited into a war of words.
My job is to listen. If you can't believe that I might be honest when I do so, the door is behind you. Now... You were saying?
This talk is over. Get out.
I really don't have the heart for this today. I don't need the criticism.
Many people come here not knowing what it is they want. I try to make them comfortable. I try to ease what bothers them.
In fact, I think I've just about had it with you. Take your problems with you when you go.
Some people just need a sympathetic ear. I try to show the kind or restraint and understanding they may not have had from the men in their lives.
People think the women of this profession are immoral, but that I am some kind of licentious devil. That's their burden, not mine.
If you see me as dishonest, I won't be able to change your mind. The door is behind you. Feel free to use it. Or stay.
Well, that certainly is a lot of pressure. So many people relying on you, even if they don't know it. That must weigh on your mind.
I can't help you in whatever task you perceive is yours, <FirstName>, but I can try to ease your mind. You can be vulnerable here.
I apologize, but I am no longer working and my time is my own. I hope this doesn't inconvenience you.
Ah, <FirstName>. You are looking well. I trust our encounter has left you with fond memories?
Perhaps one of the others can assist you? I'm sure they will be more than welcoming.
Your manner will never be a question with me, dear woman. Don't let your lovely simple heart be polluted. Ever.
<FirstName>, you are ever the perfect lady.
I was concerned at first, <FirstName>. You were a little... unpolished when we first spoke, but your manner warmed considerably. Ever the perfect lady.
Well... I am quite sure that can be arranged. Follow me. Hold tight. Hang on.
I'm certain that I can accomodate you, my lady. Follow me, and I shall douse these harsh lights.
I understand. Rest ye well, my lady. I will watch over you.
An unnecessary comment. I am sorry I could not draw a more genuine response from you.
I've got a pass for the Gauntlet.
Me gots Gauntlet pass.
Anything interesting in this tavern?
Anything neat in this place?
Let's see what you have for sale.
What's you got for sale?
Goodbye.
Give me the earnings for the week.
You give money made this week, maybe?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Come on, what harm is there in telling me?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Why you not tell? Nobody care if me know.
I don't want to resort to force, but I will if you don't tell me.
Me not want to fight, but me will if you not tell.
The Trade of Blades? What's that?
Trade of Blades? What that?
What is the Gauntlet, specifically?
What the Gauntlet be?
Why is this a big secret?
Why this all so secret-like?
What do I have to do now that I own the bar?
What me gots to do with this place now that me own it?
Greetings. Got a particular need this fine day?
Another time, friend.
Nothing that needs to be said out in the open. Nope, nothing at all.
Well met, Boss. What can I do for you?
Shh. Don't say it so loud. Here's a key. Go on down when you want. It's the door in the center of the south wall. There are stairs leading down to the basement.
You've already got a key. Go on down to the Gauntlet, if you want. It's the door in the center of the south wall. There are stairs down to the basement.
There haven't been many customers since the Gauntlet shut down, but the plague is the real cause of how slow it's been here. Business is literally dying off.
Sorry, <FirstName>, but it hasn't been long enough to work the books out. Gotta wait a week between payments.
Here's what was made. 50 gold. Like I said... not a lot.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Look, if you really want in on what happens here, you'll have to get a pass from a mercenary in the Trade of Blades. Then we'll talk.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No, I don't think so. It's nothing that concerns you.
Hmm, maybe you'd fit right in, but it doesn't matter. Not unless you get a pass from a mercenary in the Trade of Blades. Then we'll talk.
If you don't know, I doubt you'll be back. It's the mercenary guild in the northwest of the City Core. That's all I'm saying.
Hey there. Not much happening here now that we've got a new owner. Still a good bar, though.
It's a contest open to people who believe there is nothing more basic than defending yourself against someone meaning to do you harm.
Look, it ain't exactly safe for people to get in a pit and slug it out. We've had accidents... a couple people lost limbs...
You win, you get a rank and a few cheers. You lose, you get dusted off and try again. It's about knowing your worth in a fight.
The city guards think it's a bloodsport, but it's not. It's about honor in battle, but they don't understand. The guards just see what they want to.
Look, if you want to try, that's up to you. just don't blab about it, and don't complain if you lose. People don't like that.
Well, the last owner, Claudus, he set things up so he didn't have to do a thing. He was always busy with this or that.
Anyway, all you need to do is come in every week or so and I'll give you the profits that we've made. You won't get rich, but it's better than nothing.
Besides, I can tell you'd rather be out adventuring and such. You look like the type. It sounds dangerous to me, but I bet there's good coin in it.
Damn you! Damn you all! Fine! You won! So what! Proves nothing! I was Champion for months! Everyone knows that! Everyone knows...
That's it for you! You got past Agar, but it stops here. No one beats Claudus. Just ask! No one beats me! This place is mine!
You... beat Fashi, hmm? I suppose you think you are tough?! Well, don't get cocky. Agar will put you in your place.
You beat Hrusk, eh? Not surprising. He's been here weeks and hasn't got out of round one. He's ruled it, but he hasn't gotten past it.
New blood? Good! Remember, you fight one round at a time and get a medal for each victory. It's for glory alone. There's no prize.
Take the place. Go on, you are the owner now, but I've told my friends to leave. The Gauntlet goes with me! BAH!
Beaten? Proves nothing! Where are they?! I want to talk to the piece of garbage that beat me!
Oh course, if you beat all three rounds, you get to fight me. Then maybe you win the whole damn bar! Trust me, that will never happen.
He'd never beat me, but then, no one can. That's why I put the bar up as a reward. People stopped trying.
And if he doesn't, I will. Nobody beats me. If you think you'll walk out of here with MY bar, you are mistaken!
Claudus got beat! It's worth closing the Gauntlet to see him get taken down.
You got a Third Round Medal! I bet you might even be able to take Claudus! Maybe... <StartAction>(hushed)</Start> if he didn't have an "in" with the healer...
You know, you are pretty tough if you got past Fashi for that Second Round Medal. Maybe you'll actually take Agar. Maybe.
Okay, so maybe you could get past me, but there's no way you'll beat Fashi. Can't be done. No sir.
Bah! I got no time for newcomers. You want respect, you step up to the Pit.
I never thought I'd see it happen. I'm gonna miss this place.
Impressive medal. Claudus might even have to submit to you. That would be good. <StartAction>(hushed)</Start> I suspect he fights with an unfair advantage.
The medal in your possession proves you can best me, but I would prepare for a wholly different battle with Agar.
You have surpassed the level that Hrusk was fighting at. Very good. We shall have to see if you can best me.
Welcome to the Gauntlet. I look forward to seeing you present yourself in the Pit.
Me knew it could be done, but me not smart enough to do it. BAH! Me go back to real battles!
You past Third Round me! You fight good! Bet you try Claudus now! Careful, he not fight fair. Don't know how, but he not fair.
Hah! So you passed that Fashi smallkin? Bah! Me step on him too, one time. You prove you tough to ME next!
Heh, Hrusk too weak. You prove nothing beating him. Maybe Fashi test you, but he small too! Ha! Like watching children!
More meat for Pit? Good! Me tired of what here!
Goodbye.
At least tell me about the fighters.
Maybe tell about fighters?
Goodbye.
Bye bye.
What about the others?
What about other fighter guys?
What do you know about Claudus?
What Claudus fight like?
Go away, kid, you bother me.
Beats it, you bother me.
Thank you. Farewell.
Thanks, byes.
What do you know about the fighters?
What yous know about Fighters?
You watch a lot of the fights. Are they fair?
Is fights fair? You seem to know stuff.
What about the Third Round?
And Third Round? Whats about that?
What about Claudus?
It's you! It's <FullName>! I love you! I mean, I love your fighting! You took Fashi! Hell, you took Agar!
Hey there! You are doing pretty good! You got a good medal on you!
What? Why would I talk to you? You've got no medals. Feh!
Sure. See you. Good luck! You're great!
That's right, goodbye. As if I've got time for no-medals like you. Beat it.
A newcomer wants to know about the fighters? HA! Like it matters! You'd have to beat the mighty Hrusk and his pet before you're even ranked!
Hrusk has that flaming axe, you know? Burn the hair right off you, it would. Even the short stuff!
Go away. I'm done talking to your worthless butt.
I can't believe I'm talking to you. I mean, sure, maybe you used to be a no-medals, but look at you now! WOW!
Thanks! <He/She> said thanks! To me! Everyone see that?! Damn right!
I can't believe it! <CUSTOM710> is just the best! The BEST! That was great!
Hmph... wins a few medals and gets all tight... but WOW, that <FullName> can fight! Did you see <him/her> brush me off? ME!
Claudus? He's just great! It's like... I don't know! It's like he's almost invulnerable! Some people complain that he's so good, but they just can't compete.
I mean, everything is fair, right? And he doesn't use any magic weapons or anything. Just anmial companions like everyone else. He just seems like a super fighter!
Agar is the Third Round Medal fight. He's real tough. He's got a pet, like everyone else, and he's got something nasty too.
Fashi is the Second Round Medal fight. He looks small but boy, he can sure take it. It's amazing, it is.
Oh, sure. I mean, each guy has a specialty and a pet, but that's all known before a fight begins, if you ask around.
Except for Claudus. He's got no special thing, and his pets are normal like everyone elses, but he seems super-tough anyway. He's just that good.
His weapon poisons. People complained at first, but they got used to it. He's just tough anyway, so he's proved his worth.
You just can't cut him or poke him. He's so focussed. He bruises though. I noticed that. He's not invulnerable.
Don't worry about that. You won't get to him. The others are plenty tough, but Claudus is just plain scary.
Goodbye.
At least tell me about the fighters.
Maybe tell about fighters?
Goodbye.
Bye bye.
What about the others?
What about other fighter guys?
What do you know about Claudus?
What Claudus fight like?
Go away, kid, you bother me.
Beats it, you bother me.
Thank you. Farewell.
Thanks, byes.

And Third Round? Whats about that?
