That's all I need to know about the Waterdhavian creatures.
Me not need nothing else 'bout Waterdeep monsters.
I found a note you might be interested in.
Me got note you need look at.
Yes - let's go at once!
No - I need to take care of a couple things.
Yes - me ready right now!
No - me need do some stuff first.
Thank you, Aribeth. You are most generous.
I have no need of gold. Your thanks is reward enough.
500 gold pieces? This is an outrage!
Me thanks you. This be lots gold.
Me not need gold. You keep for help other people.
500 gold! This not fair! Me want more!
I require temple services.
Me need to buy temple stuff.
We are but one reagent away from our salvation, <FirstName>! Thanks to <CUSTOM100> we only need to find the fourth and final reagent from the missing Waterdhavian creatures!
You are a welcome sight, as always, <FirstName>. Is this visit in regards to the fourth Waterdhavian creature?
I have glad tidings to report, <FirstName>. <CUSTOM100> found the second of the Waterdhavian creatures. We now have two of the four components - we are halfway to a cure!
One of the bards here in Castle Never is composing a song to honor your adventures during the recovery of the second reagent, <FirstName>.
Have you heard, <FirstName>? <CUSTOM100> has recovered the first of the missing Waterdhavian creatures!
Welcome back, <FirstName>. You have done a great thing in recovering the first of the reagents for us.
Welcome, <FirstName>. Do you have news of the missing Waterdhavian creatures? Or is there something else you need?
Well done, <FirstName>! I knew you wouldn't let me down!
That old scoundrel? I suppose I cannot expect such men to give up their ways, even in times like this.
It is shameful the way such a gentle creature is mishandled. The plague does enough harm without us adding to it.
That was the reason we lost contact with those in the prison? As if the plague was not enough.
I heard of the trouble in the Beggar's Nest. This malevolent thing was behind it? As if the plague was not enough.
Welcome, <FullName>. I regret I did not get a chance to introduce myself properly to you while you were training at the Academy.
I am Lady Aribeth de Tylmarande, paladin in the service of Tyr and the right hand of Nasher Alagondar, Lord of Neverwinter. I have been waiting for you.
You truly are remarkable, <FirstName>. If nothing else you prove that wit is no match for courage and skill!
Truly the heart of a hero beats within your chest, <FirstName>! Of all who have sought the creatures you have proven yourself above everyone else!
I heard of the trouble in the Beggar's Nest. This malevolent thing was behind it? As if the plague wasn't enough.
That was the reason we lost contact with those in the prison? As if the plague was not enough.
It is shameful the way such a gentle creature is mishandled. The plague does enough harm without us adding to it.
That old scoundrel? I suppose I cannot expect such men to give up their ways, even in times like this.
You have earned a place of honor among those who sought to aid Neverwinter in these dark times. You will stand with us as the ritual to create the cure is performed.
<FirstName>, where others have found only failure you have discovered shining success. Neverwinter is in your debt.
We are all eagerly awaiting its recovery. As soon as we have the fourth component we can begin the ritual to create the cure.
Ah, dear Fenthick, the love of my life. He has been my rock during these troubled times. But even he cannot help me with this, <FirstName>.
I have been following your progress since your early training at the Academy. Neverwinter has need of a <man/woman> like you if we are to survive the Wailing Death.
The attack on the Academy doused the one faint spark of hope this city had. I need you to help recover that which we have lost, <FirstName>.
You will answer only to me, <FirstName>, and I will give you free reign in your tasks.

I promise your reward for this task will be well worth your efforts. There are many rumors about the plague, but if you are to aid me in this, it is important you know the truth about the Wailing Death.
I knew I could count on you, <FirstName>. There are many rumors about the plague, but if you are to aid me in this, it is important you know the truth about the Wailing Death.
Our divine healers can do nothing to help those afflicted by the Wailing Death, and even our most powerful magic cannot raise those who succumb to the illness.

But a short time ago we had word that Khelben "Blackstaff" Arunsun, the famous archmage of Waterdeep, had discovered a potential cure, one that might be concocted from the essence of four rare and magical creatures.

Under great secrecy the four creatures were gathered in Waterdeep then sent here to Neverwinter, as strange a menagerie as any has ever set eyes on: a cockatrice, an intellect devourer, a yuan-ti and a dryad.

I ordered them sent to the Academy, Neverwinter's renowned training institution for adventurers of every ilk. I once studied there myself and I thought the instructors and students were loyal to Lord Nasher.
The Academy may have been betrayed from within. Or perhaps I simply put too much faith in the instructors, students and staff to keep this news secret, as Desther claims.
You were there, <FirstName>. You saw the slaughter. The attack caught us unprepared. You are one of only a handful of survivors from the carnage of the Academy.

Fenthick and Desther arrived with reinforcements, but during the confusion of battle the Waterdhavian creatures disappeared into the streets of Neverwinter - and our hopes of a cure vanished with them.
You proved yourself during the attack on the Academy, <FirstName>. Your bravery and skill are obvious, and I know you are not in league with those who seek to destroy Neverwinter.

The city watch can do little to help in this search; their numbers are barely enough to keep order in the streets of Neverwinter. Others, like Fenthick or myself, have duties that require we stay here.

The city watch can do little to help in this search; their numbers are barely enough to keep order in the streets of Neverwinter. Others, like Fenthick or myself, have duties that require we stay here.

Your task in this is twofold, <FirstName>. First, find the Waterdhavian creatures and bring them back to me at any cost. We need to harvest components from these creatures if we are to concoct a cure for the Wailing Death. This is your most important duty.

Second, we must discover who was behind the attack on the Academy. Any evidence you uncover in this matter should be brought to Fenthick. He is the one assigned the task of unmasking our hidden enemy.
You proved yourself during the attack on the Academy, <FirstName>. Your bravery and skill are obvious, and I know you are not in league with those who seek to destroy Neverwinter.
Whatever rewards you seek - fame, fortune, glory - you shall have in abundance. Provided you are successful in this task.
I ask for your discretion in this matter, <FirstName>. News of the attack and strange creatures roaming the city will only add to the panic and chaos already in the streets.
You might want to seek someone to accompany you in your mission. There are a number of mercenaries for hire at the Trade of Blades, located in the City Core.
A good place to begin your search for the missing creatures might be the Peninsula District. There have been several eyewitness accounts of strange beasts in the area.
Farewell, <FirstName>. May Tyr guide your steps.
I will do my best to answer what questions I may, <FirstName>.
It is no secret that Fenthick and I are lovers. Our feelings for each other are only matched by our devotion to Tyr and our loyalty to Neverwinter.
Although Lord Nasher has placed me in charge of finding a cure for the plague, I could not do this without Fenthick's help. His faith and conviction are a comfort to me in times of darkness.
Is there anything else, <FirstName>?
I think the Helmite is arrogant, sanctimonious, self-righteous and holier-than-thou! Forgive me for being so blunt, but Desther and I do not see eye to eye.
Desther challenges my every decision on general principle, or so it would seem. He is constantly accusing me of abandoning my faith and not trusting enough in the power of the divine.

My faith in the power of Tyr is strong, yet I understand sometimes the Gods rely on mortal means to accomplish their ends. Mere blessings and prayers are not enough to end this plague, despite what the Helmites believe.
Sometimes I think Desther and his Helmites do more to hinder my efforts than help them. But Fenthick assures me they bring hope to the city, and hope is something the people desperately need.
I am not one to boast of my accomplishments, <FirstName>. Suffice to say that I am a Paladin of Tyr and I am honored Lord Nasher has placed me in charge of finding a cure for the Wailing Death.
It was a slaughter, as you well know. Only a handful of the hundreds training and teaching at the Academy survived.
As yet we have not discovered the identity of those behind the attack, but the enemy knew the Waterdhavian creatures were there. How they came by that knowledge is a troubling prospect.
Take any information concerning who may be behind the attack straight to Fenthick. He is the one I have placed in charge of unmasking our hidden enemy.
Is there something else I can help you with, <FirstName>?
I will do my best to answer your questions, <FirstName>.
The first victims were reported several months ago, and within days it had spread to all corners of the city. It was not the first plague Neverwinter has suffered, but it is by far the worst.
Unlike other sicknesses, the Wailing Death seems to resist all efforts to cure it, including the divine magic of the priests. Perhaps that is what makes it so terrible.
The plague does not seem to spread through contact with the infected. Healers tend to the sick without becoming ill, and some who lock themselves alone indoors contract the illness.
We have quarantined the city, but that is mostly to help the watch maintain order. It has done little to halt the spread, though some districts remain unaffected.

Perhaps that is what is so terrible about this affliction. There is no rhyme or reason to it, seemingly no way to guard against it and, until we have all the Waterdhavian creatures, no way to cure it.
We have quarantined the city, but that is mostly to help maintain order. It has done little to halt the spread of the disease - though some districts remain largely unaffected.
The plague does not seem to spread through contact with the infected. Healers tend to the sick without becoming ill, and some who lock themselves alone indoors still become infected.
I have no equipment to spare - all we have was given to the city watch to help them maintain order. Perhaps I could sell you some things from the temple armory...

Yes, I will arrange to sell you whatever I can. When you next come back, ask me for temple services. If I don't have something, the city core has all manner of shops to supply you with whatever you might need.
It was Khelben "Blackstaff" Arunsun, the archmage of Waterdeep, who discovered the potential cure. However, we have not even had a chance to test it. The creatures were taken from us too quickly.
If Blackstaff is right, the cure requires feathers from a cockatrice, the brain of an intellect devourer, blood from a yuan-ti and a lock of hair freshly plucked from a dryad's head.
Is there more you would know? Any information about the creatures I can provide to help you locate them will be freely given, of course.
A single drop of blood, a single scale, a lock of hair - all these can be collected with no harm to the creatures. Only the monstrously evil intellect devourer needs be slain to collect the reagent.
A cockatrice resembles a hybrid of chicken, lizard, and bat. They are repulsive animals that can petrify opponents. You must be extremely cautious when dealing with this beast.
The yuan-ti are a race of beings whose bloodlines are a mixture of human and snake. They can be any combination of snake and human characteristics.
They are highly intelligent and many of the creatures practice magic. It is rumored that some even have the ability to alter their shape.
The intellect devourer is a truly horrible entity, resembling a large fleshy brain with legs. It can dominate the minds of its victims so that it may devour their very thoughts.
She is like most of her kind: a beautiful, elusive forest sprite whose charms transcend mere physical appearance. Out of charity, she came willingly to help us when she learned of our need.
However, the city is strange to her and unsettling. When the attack came I suspect she fled in panicked terror, and now is lost among the unfamiliar streets and buildings of Neverwinter.
If you find her, treat her with the respect and kindness she deserves. She is very brave to leave her wood to come to our aid.
There are many rumors and I would not like to give you any false leads, <FirstName>. However, there is something that seems reliable.
There have been some promising reports from the Peninsula District. Several eyewitness accounts indicate a strange creature is wandering the area - or was a short time ago.
There are unsettling reports coming from the Beggar's Nest. Some say the corpses of plague victims are coming back as the undead. That might be worth investigating.
The city watch reports a near rebellion in the Blacklake District. The commoners claim the nobles have found a secret cure. Perhaps it is related to the creatures.
All secrets are known in the Docks District, but the city guard has lost control of the area. The area is run by criminal gangs now - it might be too dangerous even for you.
But there is no guarantee the reports are accurate. The creatures could be in any one of the city districts. I shall leave it up to you where you want to take your search.
However, before my men were driven out there were whispers of attempts to escape the city with a valuable prize. Perhaps someone means to smuggle one of the creatures out.
Of course, <FirstName>. I will do my best to help with whatever you need to know.
Let me see... hmmm... You were right to bring this note to our attention.
Take it to Fenthick - he is the one in charge of unmasking the enemy behind all this. He will find your note most interesting, I am sure.
Is there anything else I can do for you, <FirstName>?
It is but one small step toward our ultimate goal, but it gives me hope. And I know with your help Neverwinter shall yet be saved!
I believe I heard Lord Nasher himself humming the tune in the halls. People are beginning to take notice of you, <FirstName>.
Are you ready to go to the ritual chamber? We must leave as soon as possible.
Then we shall waste no more time - Neverwinter has suffered long enough!
You have earned the right to stand with those who sought to aid Neverwinter in this dark time. I will spare a few minutes for you to get ready.
But you must hurry, <FirstName> - Neverwinter has suffered long enough. Return and speak to me when you are ready to go on.
We have all four reagents now. Quickly, <FirstName>, time grows short.
You have earned a place of honor among those who sought to aid Neverwinter in these dark times. You will stand with us as the ritual to create the cure is performed.
Battling the plague has drained the coffers of Neverwinter. I regret I cannot offer you more than 500 gold pieces for all you have accomplished.
Is there something else you need, <FirstName>?
Your charity and selflessness are an example to us all, <FirstName>. I only wish more were as noble as you.
Were it up to me, <FirstName>, you would have a king's ransom for all you have done. However, the coffers are all but bare. The quarantine has been costly for all within the city.
The cure will now be ours, <FirstName>. Neverwinter owes you a debt it can never repay. All I can offer is this small sum of 500 gold pieces.
I must speak with you.
*groan*
*cough*
*wheeze*
*scream*
*wail*
There there...
It will all be over soon.
Shhhh... rest now
I will try to ease your suffering.
There are too many... too many sick and too many dead.
Leave me be for the moment. I am listening to Fenthick.
I can spare no time for your idle chatter, <FirstName>. I must coordinate the search of my Helmites as they try to recover the missing Waterdhavian creatures... thanks to Aribeth!
This is in addition to all our other duties: tending to the dead, comforting the sick, spreading our blessings and giving hope to the people of Neverwinter.
You should spend your time more productively, <FirstName>. Instead of speaking with me you should be out looking for the missing Waterdhavian creatures.
I suspect my Helmite brethren will prove far more useful in this task than a mere <class>, but who am I to defy the desires of Lady Aribeth?
Lord Nasher made a mistake when he appointed Aribeth to be in charge of finding a cure for the plague.
My Helmites are better equipped to deal with this crisis of faith. People should put their faith in the Gods - not in Lady Aribeth.
Aribeth trusted the Academy to protect the Waterdhavian creatures rather than relying on my Helmites, or even her own god, Tyr.
Had Aribeth delivered the Waterdhavian creatures to my Helmites, news of their arrival would not have spread so quickly through the city.
We could have kept their location secret and prevented the tragedy that befell the Academy.
The results of her actions are plain for all to see, yet even now she would rather trust a <class> such as you than rely on my Helmites!
I'm sorry I can't talk right now. I'm listeming to Desther.
I understand, Fenthick. These are troubled times.
I am honored to serve Neverwinter, Fenthick.
I'll only serve if I am well paid, Fenthick.
It be honor for me serve Neverwinter.
Me only serve if me get gold.
He has no right to speak about me like that!
Desther had better watch his mouth or he might lose some teeth!
That okay. Me understand. This be tough times.
Him should not speak at me like that!
Desther better watch him mouth or me smash him face!
Rumors?
I wish to ask you some questions, Fenthick.
Where can I find Lady Aribeth?
I thought you might be interested in this note.
I'll be going now.
I will go to Aribeth at once!
I want to ask you some questions.
I guess I better go talk to Aribeth if I want any kind of reward from all this.
Me go Aribeth right now!
Me got questions me want ask.
Me better go talk at Aribeth if me want get gold for all this.
Me want ask you some stuff.
Where me find Aribeth?
Me think you want look at this note.
Me go now.
What do you know about the attack on the Academy?
Tell me about the plague.
What do you know about a cure for the plague?
Tell me about Aribeth.
What do you know about Desther?
What you know 'bout attack at Academy?
You tell 'bout plague.
You know stuff 'bout plague cure?
You tell 'bout Aribeth?
What is your role in all this, Fenthick?
What you do here, Fenthick?
What you know 'bout Desther?
This is no trick!
Why would I do such a thing?
This not be trick!
Why me want trick you?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Fenthick should follow every lead if he wants to find out who's behind this.
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> What's the matter, Desther? Do you have something to hide?
It is an honor to serve Neverwinter, Fenthick.
Is there some type of reward for bringing this to your attention?
Me just happy to help.
You gonna give me gold for note now?
Thank you, Fenthick. You are very generous.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> This note was not easy to obtain, Fenthick. Not easy at all.
You better dig a little deeper or you won't live long enough to die from the plague!
Thanks. You nice man.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me work hard for note. Real hard.
You give more gold or me kill you faster than plague!
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Say, Desther - you Helmites are kind of like a cult, aren't you?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> A cult could have both the organization and the determination to be behind this.
The note is real, Desther!
Why would I make a fake note about a cult in Neverwinter?
Note be real!
Why me want make fake note 'bout cult?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> You knew the creatures were at the Academy, didn't you Desther?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> The attackers knew enough to go straight to where the creatures were being held.
This information is still worth investigating.
Me think we still got look into this.
Aren't you afraid of catching the plague yourself?
You not be afraid of get sick, too?
<FirstName>, you were quick to answer the summons. Allow me to be the first to welcome you to the Halls of Justice.
This is a mistake, Fenthick. We know nothing about this <class>! How can you so blindly trust <him/her>?

Desther, please. <FirstName> showed great promise throughout <his/her> training at the Academy, and has done even more in the week since the attack. Rarely has a recruit shown such potential after so short a training period.
If we are to have any hope of finding a cure for the Wailing Death we need people like <FirstName> in the service of Neverwinter.
And I still say we should put our faith in my Helmite brethren, rather than an unproven <boy/girl>.
Aribeth holds <FirstName> in the highest regard, Desther. And Lord Nasher placed her in charge, not you.
Please, <FirstName>, you must forgive Desther. The plague takes a heavy toll on us all, a toll made even greater in the past weeks by the attack on the Academy and the loss of the cure.
Such callous disregard for the suffering of others! Is this the kind of mercenary we want working for us, Fenthick?
There is nothing wrong with wanting to earn one's fortune in the world, Desther. Rest assured, <FirstName>, you will be well rewarded for your efforts.
If we are to survive the Wailing Death, Neverwinter has need of men and women like you, <FirstName>.
You speak more truth than you know, <FirstName>. Within the Academy walls the true horror of the Wailing Death had yet to be felt.
The quarantine of Neverwinter has done little to halt the spread of the Wailing Death. Bonfires burn night and day as the city watch dispose of the dead, yet the corpses are piled ever higher.
It is all we can do to contain the chaos and maintain order within the various city districts. Rumors run rampant and the citizens are on the verge of panic.
You do not understand, <FirstName>. The true horror of the Wailing Death had yet to be felt within the Academy's walls.
Because the plague cannot be cured by the priests or clerics of the city, some claim it is an unnatural thing sent by an unknown enemy bent on destroying Neverwinter.
The attack on the Academy in these past weeks will only make things worse, Fenthick - once people learn how Aribeth lost the cure through her lack of faith!
Desther! I will not have you question the faith of my true love! Aribeth believed the Academy to be a safe haven. Anyway, it is not our place to even discuss such things.
My Lady Aribeth is in charge, appointed by Lord Nasher himself to stop the Wailing Death. You must talk to her, <FirstName>, as soon as possible.
Hello again, <FirstName>, and well met as always. Is there something I may do for you?
I will answer them as best I may, though there are many things only Aribeth has the authority to discuss.
My Lady Aribeth is in the chamber beyond the north doors. There she works tirelessly to put an end to the plague that ravages Neverwinter.
Is there anything else you need, <FirstName>?
Go with the blessing of Tyr upon you.
My Lady Aribeth awaits you in the chamber beyond the north doors. There, she works tirelessly to put an end to the plague that ravages Neverwinter.
It is important that you speak with Aribeth soon, <FirstName>. But I will not refuse your request. Ask your questions.
Your mind may be simple, <FirstName>, but I sense your heart is true.
What do we have here? Hmmm... it seems the plague was unleashed on us as part of some greater plot! We may have worse trials ahead of us than the Wailing Death.
Let me see, <FirstName>. Hmmm... 'The People of the Eye'. A cult in Neverwinter is dark news indeed - especially one bent on preventing us from recovering the Waterdhavian creatures.
Let me see... hmmm... a traitor in Neverwinter? One who betrayed us at the Academy? This would explain much, <FirstName>.
You may be slow of wit, <FirstName>, but you desire knowledge. Many who are wise cannot say the same. Ask your questions.
Listen to the lack-wit speak, Fenthick! Are we turning to simpletons now? Have we become so desperate?
The Gods bestow many gifts besides intelligence, Desther: courage, heart, loyalty, strength. Do not be so quick to judge.
Greetings, <FirstName>. I must congratulate you on capturing the first Waterdhavian creature.
Have you heard, <FirstName>? The first of the Waterdhavian creatures has been recovered by <CUSTOM100>.
<FirstName>! Thanks to you we have now recovered two of the Waterdhavian creatures, and are halfway to a cure for the Wailing Death!
I have good news to report, <FirstName>! The second Waterdhavian creature has been recovered by <CUSTOM100>. We are halfway to a cure!
Well done, <FirstName>. I heard you found the third of the creatures from Waterdeep. A cure is all but within our grasp now!
Well met, <FirstName>. Have you heard? The third Waterdhavian creature has been found. A cure is all but in our hand!
What good is one creature to us, Fenthick? It is like a sword with no blade. Would you go into battle armed only with the hilt of a sword?

A sword cannot be forged without the hilt, Desther. The recovery of the first creature is an important step in finding a cure for the Wailing Death. With <FirstName>'s help we are sure to recover the other creatures soon.
Perhaps... but I will put my faith in Helm and my brethren rather than this <class> of Aribeth's.
Enough, Desther. We must all do our part to end this plague. Now, what may I do for you, <FirstName>?
Two creatures out of four, Fenthick. Half a cure is as worthless as half a horse!
We have already recoverd two creatures, Desther. Does this not give you hope we may succeed?
Hope? My Helmites spread hope and blessings throughout the city, Fenthick. We also search for the lost creatures. Only we do not seek glory like this <class>.
We are still missing the final creature, Fenthick. By now it may be forever beyond our grasp. Without all four creatures there will be no cure.
We are so close, Desther. <FirstName> will not let us down! The final creature will be ours if we just remain true to the cause!
I and my Helmite brethren prefer to remain true in our faith, Fenthick - unlike some. We seek answers from the divine Helm, not a mortal like this <class>.
We learned very little in the week after the attack occurred. You are one of the few who survived, <FirstName>. The instructors were slaughtered, and only a handful of the students are left.
You must uphold the legacy of the Academy, <FirstName>, but I know you will be equal to the task. Rarely has a recruit shown as much promise as you.
There is little else I can tell you about the attack, I fear. We have yet to uncover the identity of the mysterious assailants. Perhaps Aribeth can tell you more.
Despite the city-wide quarantine, the Wailing Death spreads quickly. Even here in the Hall of Justice we have felt the plague's touch, as you can see by the afflicted all around us.
Desther and I do what we can to comfort these poor souls, but we can do little else. Not even Neverwinter's most powerful priests can heal or raise those who contract the Wailing Death.
People are scared. They're on the verge of panic and even open rebellion, and the city watch struggles to keep order.
The panic will get worse when people learn of the attack on the Academy and how Aribeth lost the cure.
I will not have you speak ill of the woman I love, Desther! We should not even be discussing this. Aribeth must decide who is given such information; she is the one in charge.
I am afraid I cannot discuss this with you, <FirstName>. I must obey the chain of command, and my Lady Aribeth is in charge of finding a cure for the Wailing Death.
Tell <FirstName> the truth, Fenthick! Aribeth had the cure and she lost it because she trusted those at the Academy over my Helmite brethren!
I do whatever my Lady Aribeth commands, <FirstName>. Lord Nasher himself appointed her to oversee our efforts to find a cure. He could not have made a better choice.
Aribeth has placed me in charge of discovering who was behind the attack on the Academy. If you ever come across such information you may report it directly to me.
And of course I do what I can to ease the suffering of those within Castle Never who have been infected with the Wailing Death, although they are beyond my power to save.
Lady Aribeth de Tylmarande is a paladin who serves Tyr, as do I. She is young, but her faith, courage and intelligence are beyond question... as is her beauty.
You let your feelings for her cloud your judgment, Fenthick. Your lover is not without her flaws.
Aribeth and I are of one heart and soul, it is true. But that does not make her any less a paragon of virtue. None who serve Neverwinter are more capable than my Lady Aribeth.
<He/She> speaks as if I am not even in the room! No matter, I am too busy to waste my time chatting with you, anyway.
You must forgive Desther. The strain of the Wailing Death weighs heavily upon us all. But the Helmites are our allies in this dark time.
Desther and his followers arrived to offer their aid just before the city was quarantined. They came to help us when no one else dared.
What could be worse than the Wailing Death, Fenthick? I fear <FirstName> is playing a trick on you with this so called 'evidence' of some grand conspiracy!
Perhaps your simple mind considers this an amusing joke, <FirstName>. Or maybe you thought you could get a reward for this flimsy slip of paper!
Perhaps this is some kind of sick joke on your part, <FirstName>. Or maybe you thought to get some kind of reward for this flimsy piece of paper?
So you say. But anyone can write up a note, <FirstName>! Perhaps you thought you could use this slip of paper to pry a reward from Fenthick!
Please, Desther - I hardly think <FirstName> is the kind of <man/woman> to do such a thing. I think this bears further investigation, at the very least.
The plague is a trial sent by the Gods to test our faith, not part of some secret plot to overthrow Neverwinter. Chasing these conspiracy theories is a waste of time!
Rest assured that I intend to follow every lead in my efforts to find out who is behind the suffering of Neverwinter. You have done well to bring this to me, <FirstName>.
Well spoken, <sir/madam>. <FirstName> only has Neverwinter's best interests at heart, Desther. We are all on the same side.
How dare you accuse me - after all I have done for this city! You see what kind of people your Lady Aribeth prefers to work with, Fenthick?
Please, we are all on the same side here. I know you and Desther do not get along, <FirstName>, but that is no excuse for tossing out baseless accusations.
Desther and his Helmites have done as much for the city as anyone - accusing him because you dislike his attitude is beneath you and does nothing to help the situation.
Lord Nasher has given me the authority to grant compensation to those who serve our cause. For bringing me this note I can give you 250 gold.
We are lucky to have a <man/woman> like you to help us in this matter, <FirstName>. Please accept these 300 gold pieces as a reward for your actions.
You have proven your worth through your deeds, <FirstName>. Here are 200 gold pieces for your service.
You see what kind of animal Aribeth rests her hopes on? You should throw <him/her> in the dungeons for threatening you!
Relax, Desther. <FirstName> was only joking, I'm sure. Nobody would threaten us here where a single word could bring twenty guards rushing to our aid.
Although given the circumstances the jest was in poor taste, <FirstName>. Tensions are high - the Wailing Death is a great strain on us all.

<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I imagine you went to great trouble to acquire this evidence, <FirstName>. I suppose for one who is as dedicated to our cause as you I could spare another 50 gold pieces.
Careful, Fenthick, lest your generosity empty the city's coffers!
An extra 50 gold pieces will not break us, Desther. And <FirstName> has earned each and every coin.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I would give you more if I could, but I must exercise restraint lest I drain Neverwinter's coffers completely.
Before you launch a time consuming investigation into some mysterious cult, Fenthick, you might want more evidence. For all we know this note is a fake.
Your words are wise, <FirstName>. The possibility of the cult is one we must give careful consideration to.
So you claim. But we have only your word on that, <FirstName>.
Perhaps you are not as stupid as you seem. Maybe you plan to sell trinkets to ward off the evil magic of this imaginary cult. You would not be the first to exploit the panic for personal gain.
Maybe you plan to sell trinkets to ward off the evil magic of this imaginary cult. You would not be the first to exploit the panic for personal gain.
Enough, Desther! You have no right to make such accusations! <FirstName> has done nothing but help us in these troubled times.
Please accept my apologies for Desther's behavior, <FirstName>. We are all under a great deal of stress.
How dare you! I will not be slandered by these baseless accusations! Show me your proof or I will demand you be held for inciting false rumors!
Desther, settle down. We cannot begin to threaten each other over every perceived insult. <FirstName> was only making a joke.
And you, <FirstName> - you should not make such accusations, even in jest. The penalty for any who are involved in prolonging the plague is death.
*Everybody* knew the Academy was being used to house the Waterdhavian creatures, Fenthick - even the students themselves had heard the rumors!
The attack was the result of gossip and loose lips from those Aribeth chose to trust instead of my faithful Helmites. We will be wasting our time looking for this phantom spy!
You make a good point, <FirstName>. The attack on the Academy would not have been so efficient had they been relying solely on rumors.
So did Fenthick! So did Aribeth! So did every single student within the Academy walls! I do not like what you are suggesting, <FirstName>.
Desther is right, <FirstName>. There were many who knew the Waterdhavian creatures were at the Academy. You cannot just make wild accusations.
The crime for betraying Neverwinter is death, and I will not let this turn into a witch hunt! Besides, Desther and his Helmites have proved their loyalty many times over since the plague began.
Our faith protects us! Only the faithless need fear the Wailing Death, as I and my Helmites have proclaimed many times.

Desther, please. No one yet knows how the plague spreads, though contact with the infected does not seem to be a catalyst. Even so, people are burning the bodies and locking themselves indoors just to be safe.
I must speak with you.
Could I ask you some questions?
Me want ask questions.
Goodbye.
Have you heard anything about a cure for the Wailing Death?
Did you hear anything about the attack on the Academy?
How did you end up tending the afflicted here?
Have you heard any rumors lately?
You know stuff 'bout cure for sick?
What you know 'bout fight at Academy?
You be nurse. How you get your job here?
You hear gossip or rumors or stuff?
That's it? You haven't heard the rumors about a cure from Waterdeep?
You not hear stuff 'bout cure from Waterdeep?
Tell me what you've heard about Desther.
Tell me what you've heard about Aribeth.
Tell me what you've heard about Fenthick.
Tell what you hear 'bout Desther.
Tell what you hear 'bout Aribeth.
Tell what you hear 'bout Fenthick.
What were they saying?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> You don't like Desther much, do you?
What them say?
Aren't you afraid of contracting the plague yourself?
You not scared you get sick, too?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Come now, telling me won't do any harm.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Tell me. Will hurt nobody.
What can you tell me about the plague?
What you know 'bout plague?
I want to ask you something else.
Me have other question.
Can I ask you some directions?
Neverwinter big place. Me need directions.
Greetings, my <Lord/Lady>. How may I be of service?
May whatever Gods you pray to keep you safe from the plague.
On your way, then. I've got too many sick and suffering to waste my time on long goodbyes.
Off with you, then. I've no time for the likes of you.
Your mind is feeble, my <Lord/Lady>. Never fear, I am used to dealing with patients whose minds have become enfeebled. I'll speak slow so you understand..
I really should be tending the sick, but for you my <Lord/Lady> I can spare a few moments.
I really should be tending the sick, but I can spare a few moments, <sir/madam>.
Make it quick - my time is better spent easing the suffering of my patients.
There's no cure for the plague, everybody knows that! All I can do is try to ease their suffering and make their last days less painful.
I heard Fenthick and Desther whispering about it once, but they clammed up as soon as they saw me. That Desther gave me a foul look.
I was a midwife, before the plague. But there ain't many babies being born now - not live ones, anyhow. I heard Castle Never needed nurses to tend their sick and dying, so I came.
I've heard my share. Desther and Aribeth are always arguing and Fenthick's always trying to keep the peace.
Some people won't have nothing to do with the sick. They board themselves up in their homes and don't come out for no reason. And they still get the Wailing Death.
Is there something else you wanted to know? Or can I get back to my duties?
Aribeth doesn't like him, I know that much. He's got a sharp tongue and a sour face, but I think it's more than that. But it's not really my place to speak of such things.
Lady Aribeth's always telling Fenthick not to put so much faith in Desther and his Helmites. You know they're lovers? Fenthick and Aribeth, I mean. Of course you know. Everybody knows.
Poor Fenthick. He's caught in the middle between Desther and Aribeth, always ends up having to pick one side or the other when they argue about how to save the city.
Well I suppose that's about as direct as one can get.
You interested in more of my gossip, my <Lord/Lady>?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Desther and his Helmites showed up soon after the plague started, just in time to get locked inside the city when the quarantine hit.
Desther says they came because they heard about Neverwinter's suffering, but it seems like odd timing to Lady Aribeth. Or so she told Fenthick once.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Sorry, but I better not say any more. If someone overheard me, I would be in a lot of trouble.
A cure from Waterdeep? How are they going to get it here with Neverwinter under quarantine! Throw it up over the walls? You're talking crazy.
Is there something else you need? If not, I really should get back to the sick.
Desther was saying the attack was all Aribeth's fault, and Fenthick was trying to defend her. That's all I heard.
Do you have more questions? If not, I really should get back to my duties.
He's sour, that one. A bitter man with a sharp tongue. But he's a man of the cloth, and his Helmites do good work around the city, helping the sick.
Desther's not a real friendly sort, but I guess that ain't no crime. I just try to stay out of his way.
Is there something I can do for you, <sir/madam>?
What do you want? And be quick about it - can't you see how busy I am here?
As much as most, less than some, I suppose. I've seen my share of the dead and dying since I started to work here tending the sick.
I'm here to tend the sick and the dying, not play tour guide.
What do you want to know?
Yes, I suppose it would seem large to someone like you, wouldn't it?
The Helmites don't catch it from helping the sick, so why should I? The plague takes who it wants, when it wants. Nothing anyone can do about that.
None of them pay any attention to a quiet little nurse going about her duties, so I've heard all sorts of stuff about each and every one of them.
Besides, all you have to do is go outside the front door of the Hall of Justice. The City Core district has every kind of shop, store or inn you'll ever need, I suspect.
You think he'd always side with Aribeth, since they are lovers. But Fenthick's an honest man, and when Aribeth is wrong, he's not afraid to tell her so.
Make peace with your gods! Like the Phalorm before us, we are doomed!
The Wailing heralds the end of days!
Woe to the unrepentant, for they shall be struck down!
The end is nigh! Like the arrogant of Netheril, we shall fall to dust!
Death is the price we pay for our arrogance!
Lord Nasher hasn't made an appearance for weeks. Who can blame him? It stinks of burning bodies out here.
So you're Nasher's lackeys, are you? You'll smell like the rest of us after a day near the corpse burning pits.
You know what? I may not like you but I like the folks in charge even less, right now...
Has the Wailing driven you mad!? At least put some clothing on!
Aye, I'd run around naked too, if it weren't for the boils...
You'd better get some clothes on you before you get lynched as a plague-spreader!
Those wounds look terrible! You're - You're not a Wailer are you?
Aye, the Tyrists are so busy with the plague-struck, they've no time for the honest wounded!
Look at those wounds - Guards catch you trying to break quarantine?
You think you're a dim wit? You'd make a finer ruler than that fool Nasher!
Dumb as a post yet they made you militia even so, hmm?
So Lord Nasher gambled our fate on the likes of you, did he? Why, if I was Lord... !
You militia folk must enjoy waving your weapons around like that! You can't cut or bash through the stink of the burning corpses, though.
Good thing I don't have that weapon - I'd chop the head off every fool guard in the city!
Don't think you can scare me with that weapon, soldier - I follow my own law now...
You with the Tyrists? My brother died because none of them would come to see him...
What good have you clerics done us! Well, the city STINKS to the heavens. That's a start, I guess.
If you're so high and holy, why don't you cure the Wailing, huh?
Hmph. A lot of good all you wizards of the Cloaktower have done us...
All of you wizards working away in your tower - I bet you brought this on us in the first place!
Can't you use magic to get rid of the smell of the corpse burn? Or maybe you spellthrowing types used to it?
Psst! <Race> friend! I heard something about a plot to overthrow Lord Nasher - spread the word!
This city needs the rule of a good <race> lord, don't you think?
This here Wailing - it's just a plot of Lord Nasher's to get rid of good <race>-folk like us!
I bet a pretty lass like you would make a fine spy...
And here I thought that that ogre, Lord Nasher, had scared all the pretty girls away...
Think you're pretty, do you? Well you won't be for long if you keep doing that fool Nasher's bidding...
I'd rather live under the rule of a dashing fellow like you than an old fart like Nasher...
You're a good-looking chap. Are you with the resistance?
You may think you're a pretty boy but you're still doing the militia's dirty work!
Be careful around the Core - people are getting upset about how long it's taking to get a cure.
Just between you and I, I wouldn't trust anyone around these parts, least of all those in charge.
The church, the government, the militia, they've all turned on us. All we've got is ourselves...
The Tyrists keep on whining about their precious cure - You know what? There's no cure for being dead...
This is what we've become, is it? Guttersnipes and harpies, all of us...
I'd call the guard but it looks like they've sold out to the likes of you these days...
It's because of outlanders like you that we all caught this bloody Wailing...
Hmph! The heads of state are no better than a barbaric animal like you!
You smell as bad as the politics around here... Not as bad as the burn-pits, though...
Well, wonderful. Another <race> fool wandering about. Nasher's brought ruin to this place...
Hmph, more <race> rabble. If I were in Lord Nasher's shoes, I'd be rid of the whole lot of you...
Go back to where you came from, <race>-kin - You're not wanted here!
Could you answer some questions about the Blacklake district?
Yuh. Me got questions 'bout Blacklake District, okay?
Goodbye.
Is there any way I can help out in there?
How bad is it in there?
Are there any places I should look out for in the Blacklake district?
Me here to help. How me do dat?
How bad it be in dere?
You know places to watch out for in Blacklake district?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Who is in the right? The barricaded nobles or the people that want in?
I've got some general questions that need answers...
Me have questions 'bout gen'ral stuff, yuh?
Can you tell me anything about the Waterdhavian creatures?
What do you know about the Wailing Death?
Are you familiar with Lady Aribeth?
I have some questions about the Blacklake district.
Me want know more 'bout dose plague-cure creatures.
What you know 'bout da Wailin'?
You know Missus Aribeth, yuh?
Me ask stuff 'bout Black-lake Dis-Trick, yuh?
Do you know anything else about what happened that night?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Is there anyone else who might know more about the Waterdhavian creatures?
You know any ting else 'bout dat night?
I'm interested in the plague. Can you tell me anything else about it.
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Is there anyone else who might know more about the Wailing Death?
Me int'rested in plague. You know any udder stuff 'bout it?
Something about her fascinates me. Can you tell me anything more?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Is there anyone else who might be able to tell me more about her?
Hmm. She int'resting. You know more 'bout her?
Would you mind answering some more general questions for me?
Me have udder questions. Don't worry, dey simple.
Lady Aribeth has assigned me to temporary militia duty.
Missus Aribeth made me militia for li'l while.
What kind of clearance do I need?
Uh... What you mean by 'clear-rinse'?
Why do I need clearance?
Why me need 'clear-rinse'?
Sorry, no.
Hail, good <sir/madam>! The Wailing Death has created a lot of conflict beyond these gates. Lady Aribeth's ordered us to restrict access to the Blacklake district.
Be careful. There's plenty of danger afoot.
Yes, yes. On your way, then.
I'll be keeping my eye on you...
I see. A little on the slow side, are we?
I'd be happy to answer a question or two. What do you want to know?
I suppose I can answer a question for you, <lad/lass>. Go ahead.
I'll answer one of your questions... if it doesn't take long.
Well, best bet would be to talk to a guard in the area. Past my gate is a bit of the slums, but if you keep going you'll reach the Blacklake Gate.

Well, the Blacklake's split into two parts - the Nobles' Quarter, and the rest of it. The nobles are plague-free right now and sealed off tight. There's rumors the nobles have a cure that they aren't willing to share with the rest of us.

The Nobles' Quarter itself is all barricaded in, but being a guard gives you access. Once inside you can check out the zoo in the north and a rough-house tavern called the Board Laid Bare in the centre of the district, if you want.
Is there something else you wanted to know?
Don't get me wrong, I can understand the nobles' desire to quarantine themselves... but some of the biggest crooks I've known were of noble birth.

Maybe there is something to the rumors about the nobles having a cure and not wanting to share it. It doesn't sound likely, but the fact remains they're plague free while the rest of the town gets sick.
The Wailing's caused its fair share of conflict beyond these gates, <lad/lass>, making it a dangerous place. Lady Aribeth has ordered us to restrict access.
Harrumph... The Blacklake nobles won't make much of a ragamuffin like you. The Wailing's caused its fair share of conflict beyond these gates.
A little on the slow side, are we?
I'd be happy to answer a question or two. What do you want to know?
I suppose I can answer a question for you, <lad/lass>. Go ahead.
I'll answer one of your questions... if it doesn't take long.
Aye, my friend Haggard was with the night watch in the Academy when the caravan bringing the creatures came in. We found him with his throat slit after the attack, amidst the empty cages.
He had the symbol of Helm, god of all us guard-folk, gripped tightly in his frozen palm. We buried him with it that way... to honor him.
The rest, as they say, is history. Freed from their cages, the Waterdhavian creatures fled into the night and are out there still, hiding from us all.
Is there anything else you need?
The person who knows the most about it is probably Lady Aribeth, herself. She's a good soul and deadly smart, too. I'm glad she's in charge of the search.
Too little to cure it, too much to live without fear. Our only hope is to find those Waterdhavian creatures. Without them, every last one of us is dead.
Only that I've lost half my family to it by now. I stand guard in their memory.
You might want to check with the Helmite, Desther. He's new here but has been putting his own health at risk to offer Helm's blessings to the plague-struck.
Do you have a speech impediment? Oh, nevermind.
Can't say I know her as well as Abbot Fenthick, har har! But, aye, she has been a pillar of this community since she was knighted.
I'm afraid not. We must respect a person's privacy, especially in sad times such as this.
If you want the dirt on Lady Aribeth, you'd best talk to good sir Fenthick. They're due to be married in the summer, you know...
Aye, there was word she'd be hiring on adventurers to help fill the ranks. What can I do for you then?
Well, I suppose we could do a lot worse. You sound a little... slow to me, but you must have passed muster to get in at all.
We're under pretty tight lockdown right now. Unless you have the express permission of either Lady Aribeth or Lord Nasher, you'll have to remain in the Core.
Look, the Wailing Death isn't a joke. The latest estimates put the death toll in the several thousands! I even heard Lord Nasher has already come down with it.
We have no cure, not yet, so we're doing the only thing we know how to do. Limit movement, limit exposure. In other words... you'd better have clearance.
Then don't waste my time.
I assume you have proper quarantine clearance to enter the District?
In other words, if you want access to the Blacklake district, you're going to need quarantine clearance, understood?
Even if you've got quarantine clearance to get past me, there's nothing that will get you into the Nobles' Quarter...
I doubt it's true, but food attracts flies - victims of the Wailing have been flocking to the Blacklake barricades. There've been a few clashes already, so tread carefully.
Other side of that is where a Blacklake gate guard will be stationed. Maybe he'll have a better idea of how you'd fit in or help out.
Could you answer some questions about the Docks district?
Yuh. Me got questions 'bout Dock District, okay?
Goodbye.
Is there any way I can help out in there?
How bad is it in there?
Are there any places I should look out for in the Docks district?

Be careful. There's plenty of danger afoot.
Yes, yes. On your way, then.
I'll be keeping my eye on you...
I see. A little on the slow side, are we?
I'd be happy to answer a question or two. What do you want to know?
I suppose I can answer a question for you, <lad/lass>. Go ahead.
I'll answer one of your questions... if it doesn't take long.
Well, you can report in to the Gate Guard on the other side. Maybe he'll know something about the... uh, I probably shouldn't be talking about that.

It's pretty bad - I certainly wouldn't go in unequipped. I'd hide any valuables if I were you, too. In fact, it's safe to say the criminals have all but taken over the entire district. We guards do our best, but we just don't have the numbers.
Well, the biggest landmark is the Seedy Tavern up against the north wall, run by old Jim Seedy. The Golden Apple Inn is a little southwest of it.
Is there something else you wanted to know?

<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I suppose you're right... Apparently there's been increasing activity from the Bloodsailors, a local pirate's guild. What they're up to is anybody's guess but it's something big...

Well, Commander Sebile came tearing through here on militia orders a while back... but I probably shouldn't be talking about that. There are enough rumors in this city already without me adding to them.
It's pretty bad - I certainly wouldn't go in unequipped. Gate Captain Kipp can brief you once you're on the other side.

There's not much there, to be honest. With the prison at the top of the rise and all, most reputable folk and businesses steer clear. You should probably talk to Gate Captain Kipp on the other side - he can fill you in.
