We have no cure, not yet, so we're doing the only thing we know how to do. Limit movement, limit exposure. In other words... you'd better have clearance.
Then don't waste my time.
I assume you have proper quarantine clearance to enter the District?
In other words, if you want access to the Peninsula district, you're going to need quarantine clearance, understood?
Well, now that you're here, you'd damn well better have quarantine clearance if you intend to go back... Lady Aribeth's orders...
I'll die before going back to that hell hole.
You'll be easy pickings.
Alaefin will reward us handsomely for your head!
This is our turf now.
You came to the wrong part of town.
From all around you comes the scraping of metal bars slipping back into their stone sheaths. The cell doors have opened.
Deal with these nuisances, Kurdan, or your body will be the *next* I possess.
Don't bother bein' pleasant. Just gimme the secret handshake and you're in, all right?
Guess you're one of them Bloodsailors, all right. Go on in and find Seldana. She'll give you the dirt on the Gaoler's plans.
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> The bottom level? How many levels are there?
Why was the Head Gaoler torturing you?
Who's helping him?
Torture? How come?
What's the Head Gaoler up to?
What do you know about this floor of the prison?
I need you to follow me.
All right, wait here.
What da Head Guy up to?
What you know 'bout dis floor of prison?
All right, you come wit' me.
You wait here, yuh?
Okay, enough questions about the Head Gaoler.
Okay, no more questions 'bout Head Guy, yuh?
Who help him?
The Pits? What are those?
Are the doors locked or unlocked?
Where are the former prisoners holed up?
I need supplies. Are there any storerooms?
Da Pits? Ooo, what dey be?
Da doors - dey locked or unlocked?
Da prisoners - where dey hidin'?
Hmph. Der storerooms 'round here?
Yeah, I am... Get back to your cell or face the consequences.
No, I had to fight my way through them to get here.
... Why do you ask?
Yeah, me prisoner. You get back to cell before you get hurts!
Me? No, me club dem on way here.
Uh... Is dis a trick question?
Who are you, anyways?
How come you're not in your cell?
Think you could answer some questions for me?
All right, get out of here then.
Who you be, huh?
You not in cell. How come?
Uh, me have questions. You got time?
Okay den, get out of here.
That's all I need to know about the prison.
That all me need to know 'bout prison.
The Head Gaoler's right hand man is a half-orc named Kurdan Fenkt, one of the meanest prisoners in the Pit.
Four in total. The top two are the prison proper. The bottom two are the Pits.
He kept talking about cutting us, getting inside our heads. Some of our guys came out of there looking like zombies. The rest of us were... discarded.
Psst! Into the lockdown, quick, before the patrols see us!
Pull that lever. It locks the door so we'll be safe.
Thank goodness you've come, then. They've been going from cell to cell, killing us guards... I think I'm the last one left.
The Head Gaoler? He was torturing some of us former guards on the bottom level until we managed to escape.
Agreed. The Head Gaoler's a monster - We have to put a stop to him.
It's the Security Layer - Supposed to be a buffer zone between the regular prisoners and the troublemakers we throw down in the Pits...
That's where you're headed. There aren't many cells down there except those the prisoners built themselves. What they did in the Pits was their business...
The cell doors are locked but the others should all be open. If you can get inside a lockdown and seal it up, you should be safe inside.
They've barricaded themselves in the central guard room. They're sending out patrols but it's pretty haphazard - I've killed off a couple without them noticing...
Yeah, you'll find them to the north and south.
At your command.
Sure thing. I'll secure the area.
Think we'll survive the day?
You're not with the prisoners, are you?
Yeah? Well, now that I've got you cornered, I'm going to take you down like I did the last one - point blank.
You're mistrusting - not the sign of a hunter. I guess that means you're being hunted, just like me. I'm the last guard left, I think.
Just a guard. The name's Emernik.
I squeezed through the bars and snapped the neck of the prisoner they'd sent to butcher me. Too little too late - The others are all dead.
I don't see why not. We're safe in here.
The people in those cells were my friends. Abandon their memory if you want, stranger, but I'm here for some vengeance.
Just be careful. This is place is a deathtrap right now.
Looks like things are cooling down. I'm going to stay around here and try to get things back in order. Thanks for the help.
What are you, prisoner or guard?
Stand back! How do I know I can trust you?
Relax - I set you free, didn't I?
What you be, huh? Pris'ner or guard guy?
You stay back! How me trust you, huh?
Huh? Me no cap-tor - me set you free!
Then I could use some information.
How did you end up in that cell in the first place?
What's the layout of this floor?
What do you know about the prisoners?
How you get 'prisoned anyway?
Think you can make your way out of here alone?
Any suggestions as to what we do now?
Okay, enough questions.
How dis place laid out?
What you know 'bout pris'ners?
What we do now?
Okay, questions all done.
Hmm. Me have questions.
You okay runnin' for door alone?
And the Head Gaoler?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> The Pits? What's that?
And da Head Guy?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Did the Head Gaoler keep a logbook at all?
Okay, get out of here, then. I've cleared the way for you.
Okay, you go now den. Me already clear path for you.
I could use some information before you go.
Please, you have to get me out of here.
These cell doors are operated by levers in the two guard rooms near the main entrance.
I've got a wife and family. Please help me.
Beware of the patrols. I think this corridor's the only one that's safe.
Thanks, I've been in there too long...
I think it's fair to assume you're not one of my captors, are you?
You're not one of my captors, are you? No, I'd recognize your face if you were.
You're with them, aren't you - the former prisoners... Please don't hurt me.
Well I *used* to be a guard... until the Head Gaoler turned everything upside down, at any rate. Look, I'm with the good guys, all right?
Look at me, I'm unarmed. If I knew anything about magic, I would have been out of here long ago... Look, the name's Commander Ralston, all right?
I thought maybe you're one of them come to take me downstairs... I'm Commander Ralston, by the way. I used to be in charge of this floor.
All right but the sooner I get home to my family, the happier I'll be.
I don't know but I'm going to try. I figure if I make a run for it, I can make it out the main door.
Good. If they see me out of my cell, I'm a dead man.
Hard to say. One afternoon, the Head Gaoler just went down and unlocked the door to the Pits.
He walked right in there and all the prisoners walked right out. The fighting lasted a couple of days but all us guards have been captured now... or worse.
Apparently he's still down there. The prisoners have damn well crowned him king. If you ask me, the Wailing's got him and driven him mad...
That's where we throw the prisoners we can't handle. It's every man for himself down there.
Stairs down are on the west side. There are two cell wings, North and South, with a corridor that runs between them.
Each wing has a guard room with a lever to open the cell block. The south wall also has the Head Gaoler's old office.
The former prisoners, you mean? They're cruel, vengeful. When they came, we weren't ready for them. I saw a dozen friends cut down around me.
It was horrible, <sir/madam>! They threw a bunch of us guards into the Pits, too. For the Head Gaoler, they said... like he's going to eat them or something!
I don't know about you but I'm heading home to my wife and kids. Set the whole place on fire as far as I'm concerned.
Yes <sir/madam>! Wish me luck.
I'm sure he did - the man was meticulous. He's probably got a million of them hidden away in his desk somewhere.
I figure the militia must have this place surrounded by now.
Well, seems like all the prisoners have had the fight scared out of them. Whatever you did, I'm grateful. You saved what few of us guards are left.
Nothing keeping me here now. I'm getting home to my family. If you hadn't cleaned this place out, I'd have said burn it behind me.
Good luck to you. I got nothing else to say.
Just a man like any other, maybe driven mad by the plague.
I'm hoping it's one of the Waterdhavian creatures, actually.
Who are you and why are you helping the Head Gaoler?
You're not even worth my time. Die, grunt!
Jus' some guy. Maybe he go plague-mad, yuh?
Hmm. Me hope he creature for plague-cure.
Who you be? Why you help dat man?
Grrr! Don't waste time. Me kill you now!
What proof do you have of this?
What's inside him, then? Have you seen it?
Yuh? Me no believe you. Prove it.
What inside him, den? You see it?
Guards into zombies? What are you talking about?
You say zombie-guards?
All right, you stay here. I'm going after the Head Gaoler.
Okay, you stay. Me go after Head Guy.
How horrible. Is there any way to rescue them?
Hmm. Is dere some way me can rescue dem?
Sounds like the Waterdhavian Intellect Devourer Aribeth needs.
Sound like Intellectal devo... deveroreror... uh... brain eater Aribeth wants.
You let the Head Gaoler walk all over you? How come?
You were king of nothing - there's nothing here.
The Head Gaoler's just sick with the Wailing, that's all.
Why you let Head Guy take over?
King of da Pits? Why dat make you proud?
Head Guy jus' sick wit' Wailing, dat's all.
Yes, master. We lay wait for dem here.
Hrrr... You show prowess in battle. I surrender to you.
So you hunt da Head Gaoler, yuh? You know what you face?
The Wailing? No. Head Gaoler, he no man anymore, just a shell of a man. On the inside, something eat his brain. It sees through his eyes, and makes him... different.
Why he set prisoners free? Why he make guards into zombies? Why he trust me to watch that back of his? Why? Because he ain't Alaefin anymore.
You meet them soon enough. They down in his lair, protectin' him. Feedin' him. He say he make me like them if I not serve him...
Ha! Maybe you can talk sense into them. Talk to them all and maybe there be no place for brain creature to jump to. It gets into new people real fast.
Yeah, I seen it. It's small like a dog and smells like dead moss. No head, just a big brain all open. That must be why it likes eating them so much.
I not know about that stuff. I just know that Head Gaoler was tough, and if brain creature can get him, then it's stronger than him, so it's really dangerous...
Hrrr, I not stay here. If Head Gaoler kill you, he know I surrender to you, and he eat my brain for that. I not want that.
Hrrr, I not know much 'bout that. All I know is that he not a man, just a shell of a man.
On the inside, something ate his brain, and sees through his eyes, making him different.
I Kurdan Fenkt. I was king of the Pits, 'till Head Gaoler come down here. Now he king of the Pits and I is just his lackey. Hrrr...
He have power to turn folk into zombies. He do it to guards, even. He threaten to do it to me, too.
Da Pits is what you make of it. Better to be king of Pits den not be any king at all... How many kings you know, anyway?
Hrrr. Then you ain't worth my surrender. If I die, I die as king of da Pits, then. Come on!
Yeah, maybe that it. Talk to the people so they go away. Otherwise, you'd best kill the thing inside the Head Gaoler and kill it fast.
You go fight him. Maybe talk to his guards too, so they leave and brain thing not jump in them. Yeah, you do that. I get out of here.
The clang of metal bars echoes through the north wing of the prison.
Who are you?
I'd like to ask you some questions.
I need directions.
Who you?
Me have questions.
Me need directions. Is big place.
Goodbye.
I'm called <FirstName>.
My name is <FullName>. I'm an adventurer.
I don't generally give out my name.
Go soak your head. I'm not telling you who I am.
Me is <FirstName>.
Me called <FullName>. Me be big adventurer.
Me not usually say.
You get lost, me not telling.
What kind of job?
What job you speak of?
How do you intend to get me into the prison?
That doesn't seem like much pay for a lot of work.
Perhaps you'd be willing to give an advance... ?
What dangers are you aware of?
All right, I guess I'm your <man/woman>.
No, I'm not interested in this.
How you get me into dis prison, anyway?
Not much pay for lots work.
Maybe you give some gold now... ?
What dangers dere be?
Okay, me do it.
No, me no do dis stuff.
What was it you needed doing again?
Something was controlling Head Gaoler Alaefin. I've got a piece of it.
Yes, I've changed my mind. I'll do it.
No, I'm still not interested.
What you want again?
Head Guy Alaefin was controlled by thingy. Me kill it, and got piece.
Yes, me want to do it now.
No, me still not interested.
Yes, that will do nicely.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I went through considerable trouble to get this... wouldn't a higher reward be suitable?
Better offer some more money, woman. I'd hate for you to... come to harm.
Yuh, dat amount be okay.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me have hard time taking dis. Bigger reward be better, yuh?
You give more gold or me get angry, start killin' more den just pris'ners!
I need no reward. The Prison's troubles have been resolved and that is all that matters.
Me no need gold. Prison stuff fixed now, dat's all wut's important.
Head Gaoler Alaefin was controlled by something.
I'll get back to it. Farewell.
I'm not interested anymore.
Gaoler guy Alaefin controlled by nasty creature.
Me get back to it. Bye.
Me not care no more.
Sorry, not interested. I'll be going now.
Me not interested. Me go now.
Lady Aribeth has temporarily assigned me to militia service.
Aribeth make me into militia for li'l while.
Alaefin? What can you tell me about him?
Alley-fin? What you know 'bout him?
How do I get into the prison, again?
How me get in prison?
Tell me again what the reward will be.
What reward again?
Sure is good to see a friendly face. What brings you here in the midst of all this chaos? You wouldn't be a new recruit, would you?
What brings you here? The guards weren't supposed to let anyone else into the Peninsula District... say, you aren't a new recruit, are you?
Who are you and why did the guards let you in here? There's enough trouble in this district without thugs like you... wait, you aren't a new recruit, are you?
Sedos Sebile, of the Neverwinter Militia. I'm in charge of the operation here... And you?
Look, there's a crisis out there and I have little time for friendly banter. What I need are warm bodies to throw at a problem outside of regular militia duties.
Remain safe, friend.
Take care.
Yes, on your way, then.
Very well. <FirstName> it is. Truth be told, we've got our hands full here in the Peninsula and could use your help... it's a bit outside standard militia duties though.
An adventurer, hmm? Very well, <FullName>, I could use your help here in the Peninsula... it's a bit outside standard militia duties though.
As you wish. All the same, we've got our hands full here in the Peninsula and could use your help... it's a bit outside standard militia duties though.
With all the prisoners in the streets, we're stretched to the limit just trying to keep the civilians safe... As if the Wailing wasn't enough...
What I need is someone to get inside that prison and figure out what the hell is going on down there.
They're running the prison like a fortress, sending out raiding parties and then retreating back inside. It's been hard to get a hold of them.
Perhaps, but the prisoners will likely have stripped the place of any valuables, and you're welcome to keep anything you confiscate from them.
Certainly not. If I gave an advance to every militia member, the city coffers would be empty and the prisoners would still be rioting.
Besides the prisoners, you may need to watch out for the Head Gaoler, Alaefin. Recent reports suggest he's the one who set them loose in the first place...
Good luck then, and don't forget to report back to me if you manage to resolve whatever the trouble is down there.
Well, I can lead the horse to water but I can't make <him/her> drink. If you'll excuse me, then, there's lots to do in these troubled times.
You again, is it? Have you changed your mind about entering the prison for me?
Then we have little to talk about and you are wasting valuable time. Excuse me, I have a job to do.
Let's have a look at that... It's the brain of an intellect devourer, isn't it? So that's why Captain Alaefin was acting so strangely! Of course!
The intellect devourer was one of the Waterdhavian creatures that Lady Aribeth has been searching for to help cure the plague! You'd better return this to her.
I thank you for all the trouble you have taken in completing this task, then. I will speak well of you when I make my report.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> True, you appear to have performed admirably under such pressure. Here, take 375 gold, then, and I will make note of it in my report.
Now, if you'll excuse me, I must prepare that report to present to Lord Nasher. He is not well, but news of your success should lift his spirits some.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> This is militia business, <sir/madam>, and we play it by the book. I'll make note of your concern in my report.
You had a job to do and you did it. Here's your pay, 300 gold. I'll make note of your attempt to threaten me in my report.
Indeed, good <sir/madam>. You have performed admirable service and declined all reward. I will speak most highly of you when I make my report.
Hello there. I'm glad to see people alive. I'm not sure what happened in the prison, but whatever it was, it's had a big effect on everyone out here.
As you wish, <sir/madam>, but I have my orders and shall remain here until the job is done.
Excellent. I shall await your return, then.
Do you have evidence to support that you have ended the threat? I cannot report this until we know for sure.
I really must file my report with Lord Nasher. Excuse me, <sir/madam>.
Bring me proof that you have dealt with whatever you claim was controlling him. Then we shall see about your reward.
I think they probably carry keys to get back into the fortress once they've finished looting or whatever. Nobody we've caught has had one, though.
Since you can't bust down the front door, you'll have to find the person with that key. I'd start near the sewers in the southwest of the district. We've seen a number of groups around there.
That said, this is proof enough that you've done the job I required of you. I imagine 300 gold in danger pay will be sufficient.
Has she now? Well, that's the first bit of welcome news I've heard all day.
Lady Aribeth's authorized a 300 gold piece bonus to any militia member who can bring me proof that the situation's been resolved. Consider it danger pay.
He used to be one of the militia's best and, until now, I'd never heard a bad word said of him. Lord Nasher himself appointed him to the prison's command.
Something just doesn't seem right with this picture. I guess the Wailing can change one's perspective on things...
The escaped prisoners seem to be a little less vicious. Certainly they are still dangerous, but whatever was driving the riot seems to be gone. I have no explanation.
Hello again. I hope your search for the cause of the riots goes well. We need all the help we can get here. Have you found anything in the prison?
Aribeth has authorized a 300 gold piece reward. If you wish more, we will discuss it when you produce results.
The escaped prisoners keep sending raiding parties out of the prison. One of them must have a key to get back in.
You'll have to find who has that key. I don't know any more than that.
The clang of metal bars echoes through the south wing of the prison.
There is a large hole in the side of Lady Tanglebrook's skull, the contents having been violently removed. Whatever caused this, it wasn't the Wailing Death.
Docked Long Boat
Illithid Grand Hall
Slave Huts
Temple
Hello, you must be one of the new city guard. I wish you luck.
The Wailing Death has claimed so many lives. Why do people like Meldanen have to make things worse?
Stay away from me! You look like the sort that might carry the plague.
Degenerate! Show some modesty and dress yourself! This isn't Calimshan!
Why are you naked? The plague must be affecting your mind! Get your filth out of the Blacklake!
A naked plague victim! How did you get past our barricades? Don't touch me.
Such wounds! Did plague victims attack you? I had thought our barricades would keep them at bay.
You're bleeding! I bet that Meldanen had something to do with your trouble.
You look absolutely wretched! Did you clash with Meldanen's guards?
Don't brandish your weapon at me. There's enough to fear in this place with the plague and Meldanen.
Keep your weapon down, lest Meldanen and his guards think you a threat.
A proper member of society does not wander about with their weapon drawn.
You're a holy <man/woman>! Can you explain why the gods allow the privileged of Blacklake to be enslaved by fear of the plague? I thought not.
I regret that the Blacklake must shut out the plagues and weak, but what choice do we have? Your gods do nothing.
The gods have left the Blacklake to fend for itself. Why else would someone like Meldanen be allowed to threaten people so?
Best keep your magics to yourself around here, <sir/madam>. Everyone is on edge because of Meldanen.
I think the plague is a result of the poor classes we allowed into the district. The barricades were long overdue.
You magical folk can't do anything about the plague either, can you?
Well, nice to see another of <race> descent in these parts. Keep low. The locals are quick to accuse outsiders of contributing to the plague.
It's nice to see not everyone <race> has been taken by the plague. Careful around Meldanen's place. He's was nasty enough before, but now...
Be wary of the humans in this district, my friend. They are quick to judge. Be extra wary of that Meldanen fellow.
Hello, miss. Forgive my forward manner, but you are the very model of feminine beauty.
Always a pleasure to bump into a pretty lass like yourself.
You certainly bring a different flavor to the district, my lady. A treat for the eyes in this dark time.
My, my. Hello there, handsome.
You've the right good manners of a gentleman. Not like that Meldanen cad.
You're a handsome one. Just don't catch the plague, or your looks won't last long.
A word of advice. If you get the Wailing Death, you won't last long in this district. We'll put you behind the barricades.
How do you do, my <lord/lady> guard? I trust everything is well at the barricades, and that no plagued sods will make it through?
You'll have to pardon me. The plague has taken my desire for conversation.
I hope a plague cure is found soon. The barricades can't keep everyone out.
Don't touch me! You're ugly enough to be one of the plague-stricken. Why didn't the barricades keep you out?
Stand away from me. You could be one of Meldanen's thugs, or even a plague victim!
Hmph! Barbarians like you probably brought some strange mountain disease down upon us. Why were you allowed past our barricades?
A barbarian! I thought the barricades would have kept your kind out of our district. This is probably Meldanen's doing.
You don't belong among the nobles of Blacklake. What are you, another of Meldanen's thugs?
Well, wonderful. More <race> rabble. Plague carriers, I bet. We should hire more men for the barricades, or hire some away from Meldanen. What does he need so many for?
I have better things to do than chat with any old <race> n'er-do-well that wanders by. You're probably up to dirty business with that Meldanen.
For all we know, it was <race> trickery that started this whole plague business. We should put you behind the barricades as well.
Could I ask you some questions?
Me want ask questions.
Goodbye.
What have you heard of the Waterdhavian creatures on the loose?
Any strange events lately that you can think of?
Anything interesting going on in Blacklake?
You hear 'bout Waterdhavian creatures, maybe?
Any strange stuff happen?
What going on here?
Any idea where they could be if they came here?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Has there been anything odd since the creatures escaped, that you remember?
You think where they go if they came, maybe?
Anything you consider odd?
Anyone in need of assistance that you know of?
Places of interest, perhaps?
Odd stuff?
Someone need help, maybe?
Neat places to go?
There's been no cases of the plague here at all?
No plague here at all?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Come now, telling me won't do any harm.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Tell me. Will hurt nobody.
What do you know about the plague?
What you know 'bout plague?
I want to ask you something else.
Me have other question.
I need directions.
Me need directions.
Where is the nearest temple?
Is there a place to buy equipment nearby?
I'm looking for a good tavern.
Me look for temple.
Me need place to buy stuff.
Good place to drink?
Actually, I'd rather ask you about something else.
No, me have other question.
I made it past the gate, didn't I?
Watch your tone. I've had enough of being challenged.
I am a member of the guard, working for Aribeth.
Me get past gate, no?
Watch tone! Me no like always being yelled at!
Me is a guard, work for Aribeth.
Yes, and to the Abyss with your orders, I'll go where I like.
Yeah, and me no care about orders. Me go where me wants.
Anything else?
Any more?
Who might you be, <sir/madam>? I don't recognize you. You are aware the district is off-limits to all but residents and the city guard?
Fare you well, my <lord/lady>.
As you wish, <sir/madam>.
Yes, yes, off you go.
(sigh) Why do I always get stuck with this type?
I'd be happy to answer a question or two, my <lord/lady>.
I suppose I can answer a question for you, <sir/madam>.
If it doesn't take too long. Go ahead.
I heard something about some beasts loose in the city... but I haven't seen anything like that here in Blacklake, that's for certain.
Nothing to do with the plague, no. We haven't been getting much news here since we closed the district off.
Could be, I suppose. What kinds of things you find interesting?
There's been a couple of incidents... but we've quarantined them right away. But no... no outbreaks, thankfully. No idea how long that'll last, though.
Is there something else you wanted to know?
Well... there is the business with Meldanen's visitor. But I'm not supposed to talk about that...
Hmph. That Formosa keeps on going on in the southeast square about how she wants help. Someone should shut her up, you ask me.
I don't know. Maybe the zoo? That's in the northeast. Me, I like the Board Laid Bare... you should check out the basement. Heh.
Well, that's pretty rich. I don't think you are quite what people here are looking for. Someone looking for you? Ha!
Is there something else you wanted to know?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I suppose you're right. Meldanen's had this strange woman visiting him the past few days. He's been real secretive about her.
Some of the fellows think he's holding her there... he's just the type. At any rate, his estate is up in the northwest if you want to go there. I wouldn't.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Sorry, but I don't want to be on the wizard's bad side. If you want to know about it, go see him at his estate in the northwest.
You could try the zoo up in the northeast. Maybe something's hiding there, I don't know.
Is there something else you need, then?
Hmm. You know, that's when Meldanen got his new visitor. Some strange woman that he's been real insistent on us guards not talking about. Even paid us some gold.
I can tell you, though. The lass is strange, and it does fit the time... but what do I know? Meldanen lives on an estate in the northwest, at any rate.
Identify yourself, <sir/madam>! Blacklake is off-limits to all but district residents and the city guard!
You there! Identify yourself! How did you find your way into the district, tell me!
Well... I suppose telling a fellow <race> can't hurt. Meldanen's had this strange woman visiting him the past few days. He's been real secretive about her.
Not much more than anyone else, thankfully. Patrolling here in Blacklake has its advantages, after all.
Where do you need to go?
(sigh) Make it quick.
What do you want to know?
Yes, I suppose it would seem large to someone like you, wouldn't it?
There ain't no temple in Blacklake. If there were, the clerics would likely be kicked out, anyway.
Not really. You can buy stuff at the Board Laid Bare, though. It's a tavern by the south gate.
Board Laid Bare. Near the south gate. Interesting stuff going on in the cellar.

Well, yes... I suppose you did, at that. Come to think of it, you're working for Lady Aribeth, aren't you?

Right, I remember now.
My apologies, my <lord/lady>. Can't be too careful with folks getting desperate and all. I'll tell the other patrolmen about you, to be sure.
I suppose you have that right, working for the city as you do. I'd be more polite around the established guards, though; you'll need what friends you can get.
Greetings, my <lord/lady>. Is there something you need?

Off already? Another day, then, <mister/missus>.

Run off, then, an' leave an old woman to 'er work.

Seems to me like ye already have, <boy/girl>, heh.

Well... there is that whole business with Formosa. But it's not polite to talk about such things.

I keeps the streets an' such swept around here. An' to get a few extra coppers I takes in laundry from the neighbours, aye.
Oh, I'm sure there's some that'd like everyone to think that, but it weren't true. There's servants an' poor folk alike here in the Blacklake.
